member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TStackedMode
member.summary: Way the series stack one to the other. This does not apply to all chart types.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TStackedMode.Standard
member.summary: Data is not Stacked. Each series is drawn after the other along the z-axis.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TStackedMode.Clustered
member.summary: Data is not Stacked. Each series is drawn after the other along the x/y-axis. If only applies to bar or column charts, where each bar is drawn one after the other around the axis. A 3D bar chart can be either standard (where each bar is drawn along the z axis), or Clustered (where each bar is drawn along the x axis).

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TStackedMode.Stacked
member.summary: Data is Stacked. (for example in stacked bar chart)

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TStackedMode.Stacked100
member.summary: Data is stacked and normalized to 100%. (This is a 100% stacked bar/column chart)

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ChartSeries.DataFormats
member.summary:
Format on the cell where the data is. So for example if you are charting a range A1:A3, this property will return an array with the numeric format strings for A1, A2 and A3.
This format is applied to the data if the data format for the axis or the label is null.
Each value in the array holds the format for one data point in the chart.
member.remarks: You can't change this value, since it is the cell format. To change it, change the cell formats for the data instead.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ChartSeries.CategoriesFormats
member.summary:
Format on the cell where the data is. So for example if you are charting a range A1:A3, this property will return an array with the numeric format strings for A1, A2 and A3.
This format is applied to the data if the data format for the axis or the label is null.
Each value in the array holds the format for one data point in the chart.
member.remarks: You can't change this value, since it is the cell format. To change it, change the cell formats for the data instead.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ChartSeries.ChartOptionsIndex
member.summary: Index to the ChartOptions object that applies to this series. Note that in xlsx charts, this is the number of subchart where the series is. So when setting series, you don't need to specify the ChartOptionIndex: CoherentFlexCel will use the number of subchart no matter what you specify here.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ChartSeries.SeriesIndex
member.summary: Index of this series on the file.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ChartSeries.VerticalErrorBars

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart
member.summary: Information for a chart inside a sheet or an object.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart.IsXlsxChart
member.summary: Returns true if the chart is defined inside an xlsx file instead of xls. While both charts in xls and xlsx files are mostly compatible, some behaviors can change depending on what type of chart this is. For example, if the first series in an xls chart is pie, it won't draw gridlines even if the second isn't. In xlsx charts, if another series is not pie, Excel will draw the gridlines.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart.Background
member.summary: Returns the chart background if there is one defined, or null if there is none.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart.DefaultFont
member.summary: Returns the default font for all text in the chart that do not have a font defined.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart.DefaultLabelFont
member.summary: Returns the default font for all labels in the chart that do not have a font defined.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart.DefaultAxisFont
member.summary: Returns the default font for Axis in the chart that do not have a font defined.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart.DefaultAxisTitleFont
member.summary: Returns the default font for Axis title in the chart that do not have a font defined.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart.DefaultTitleFont
member.summary: Returns the default font for Title in the chart that do not have a font defined.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart.Style
member.summary: This is a number between 1 and 48 which defines many standard properties for the chart, like the default line width for the series or the legend. The default style is 2.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart.SubchartCount
member.summary: A chart can have multiple subcharts inside: For example one bar chart and one pie chart. This method returns how many subcharts you have inside the main chart. Note that this property only works in xlsx files: In xls files it will always return 1.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart.SeriesInSubchart(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the number of series on each subchart. Note that this property only works in xlsx files: In xls files it will always return 0.
member.param: Number of the subchart. (1 based)

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart.AddSubchart(CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartType,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Adds a new subchart to the existing chart. Note that if the current active subchart is empty, this method will not add a new subchart, but replace the empty one. In that case, won't change.
This method only works in xlsx files, not xls.
member.param: Type of subchart added. If it is the same as the current chart type, it won't be added.
It can be 0 if the axis of this subchart will be the primary pair of axis, or 1 if they are the secondary pair.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart.ChartOptions
member.summary: Returns the type of chart and the options specific for that kind of chart. There might be more than one ChartOptions returned, since you can mix more than one type of chart on a simple chart. (One for each series). You need to look at the series ChartOptionsIndex to know to which one it refers.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart.SetChartOptions(System.Int32,CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartOptions)
member.summary: Sets the chart options of a specific subchart inside the chart. Note that while a chart can have multiple subcharts inside (for example one pie subchart and one line subchart), normally there is only one subchart and so the SubchartPos parameter is normally 1.
member.param: Position of the subchart (1 based)
Options to set in the subchart.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart.PlotArea
member.summary: Returns or sets the plot area definition for the chart. Note: Setting the plot area only works in xlsx files.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart.PlotEmptyCells
member.summary: Defines how null cells will be plotted on the chart.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart.ShowDataInHiddenRowsAndCols
member.summary: Defines if hidden rows and columns will be used when plotting values.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart.SetObjectText(System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the text for an autoshape. If the object does not accept text, this method will do nothing. This version of the method will only modify the text of the object, and preserve the existing formatting in the object if there was one.
member.param: Index of the object (1-based)

Index to the child object you want to change the text. If it is a simple object, you can use String.Empty here, if not you need to get the ObjectPath from
If it is "absolute"(it starts with "\\"), then the path includes the objectIndex, and the objectIndex is not used. An object path of "\\1\\2\\3" is exactly the same as using objectIndex = 1 and objectPath = "2\\3"
Text you want to use. Use null to delete text from an AutoShape.

member.summary: Sets the text for an autoshape. If the object does not accept text, this method will do nothing. This version of the method will only modify the rich string properties of the object text, and preserve those things not available in a TRichString like wordArt effects.

Text you want to use. Use null to delete text from an AutoShape.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart.DeleteObject(System.Int32)

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart.GetImage(System.Int32,System.String,CoherentFlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType@,System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an image and its type.
member.param: Index of the image. (1 based)

Object path to the image when it is a grouped image. For toplevel images you can use String.Empty. In other case, you need to use the value returned by
If it is "absolute"(it starts with "\\"), then the path includes the objectIndex, and the objectIndex is not used. An object path of "\\1\\2\\3" is exactly the same as using objectIndex = 1 and objectPath = "2\\3"
Returns the image type for the data returned. (If it is a bmp, jpg or other)
Stream where the image data will be copied.

If false (the default) then imageIndex is an index to the list of images. When true imageIndex is an index to the list of all objects in the sheet. When you have the object id, you can avoid calling ObjectIndexToImageIndex which is a slow method, by setting this parameter to true.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelChart.AddAutoShape(CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapeProperties)
member.summary: Adds an autoshape to an exiting embedded chart. Note that the coordinates for the shape are in chart coords, meaning that only row1, row2, col1 and col2 are used, and they represent the percentage in 1/4000 of the coordinate. So 0 means the top and left of the parent chart, and 4000 means the bottom and right of the parent chart.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChart3DOptions.XRotation
member.summary: Specifies the amount a 3-D chart shall be rotated in the X direction in degrees. Must be between -90 and 90.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChart3DOptions.YRotation
member.summary: Specifies the amount a 3-D chart shall be rotated in the Y direction in degrees. Must be between 0 and 360.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChart3DOptions.HeightPercent
member.summary: Height of a 3-D chart as a percentage of the chart width. Must be between 5% and 500%.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChart3DOptions.DepthPercent
member.summary: Depth of the 3-D plot area as a percentage of its width. Must be between 1 and 2000.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChart3DOptions.Perspective
member.summary: Specifies the field of view angle for the 3-D chart in degrees. Must be between 0 and 100. IMPORTANT: In Excel 2007 or newer, this value is displayed on screen in 1/2 degrees instead of degrees, so it will show as the double of the value you see here. In Excel 2003 or older it is displayed in degrees instead.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartLayoutTarget
member.summary: Defines if the coordinates of the enclosing rectangle include the axis marks and labels.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartLayoutTarget.Outer
member.summary: Specifies that the plot area size shall determine the size of the plot area, the tick marks, and the axis labels.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartLayoutTarget.Inner
member.summary: Specifies that the plot area size shall determine the size of the plot area, not including the tick marks and axis labels.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartLayoutMode
member.summary: Specifies how the coordinates of a chart rectangle apply.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartLayoutMode.Auto
member.summary: The coordinates have no meaning, the value will be calculated automatically

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartLayoutMode.Factor
member.summary: Specifies that the Width or Height shall be interpreted as the Width or Height of the chart element.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartLayoutMode.Edge
member.summary: Specifies that the Width or Height shall be interpreted as the Right or Bottom of the chart element.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartRelativeRectangle
member.summary: A rectangle used in charts that is relative to a parent rectangle. The coordinates of the rectangle go between 0 and 1 where 0 means 0% of the coordinate of the parent, and 1 means 100%.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartRelativeRectangle.#ctor(CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartLayoutMode,CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartLayoutMode,CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartLayoutMode,CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartLayoutMode,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new TChartRelativeRectangle.
member.param: See
See
See
See
See
See
See
See

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartRelativeRectangle.X1
member.summary: Percent of the parent coordinate. 0 means parent.Left and 1 means parent.Right.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartRelativeRectangle.Y1
member.summary: Percent of the parent coordinate. 0 means parent.Top and 1 means parent.Bottom.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartRelativeRectangle.X2
member.summary: Percent of the parent coordinate. This value depends on . If WidthMode is Factor, then 0 means 0 width, and 1 the width of the parent. If WidthMode is Edge, then 0 means parent.Left and 1 means parent.Right.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartRelativeRectangle.Y2
member.summary: Percent of the parent coordinate. This value depends on . If HeightMode is Factor, then 0 means 0 height, and 1 the height of the parent. If HeightMode is Edge, then 0 means parent.Top and 1 means parent.Bottom.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartRelativeRectangle.XMode
member.summary: Defines how behaves. When this value is Factor, X1 is a percent of the offset from the default position. When this value is Edge, X1 is the left coordinate of the point.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartRelativeRectangle.YMode
member.summary: Defines how behaves. When this value is Factor, Y1 is a percent of offset from the default position. When this value is Edge, Y1 is the top coordinate of the point.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartRelativeRectangle.WidthMode
member.summary: Defines how behaves. When this value is Factor, X2 is a percent of the width of the rectangle. When this value is Edge, X2 is the right coordinate of the rectangle.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartRelativeRectangle.HeightMode
member.summary: Defines how behaves. When this value is Factor, Y2 is a percent of the height of the rectangle. When this value is Edge, Y2 is the bottom coordinate of the rectangle.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartRelativeRectangle.CalcRect(CoherentFlexCel.Core.TPointF,CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIRectangle)
member.summary: Calculates the dimension of the rectangle given the parent rectangle.
member.param: Point with the default position to be used by the parent. When mode is not factor, it is not used.
Parent rectangle coordinates.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartRelativeRectangle.CalcRect(CoherentFlexCel.Core.TPointF,CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIRectangle,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the absolute rectangle given the parent rectangle.
member.param: Point with the default position to be used by the parent. When mode is not factor, it is not used.
Parent rectangle coordinates.
Set it to -1 to reverse the x direction, or to 1 to keep it normal.
Set it to -1 to reverse the y direction, or to 1 to keep it normal.

member.summary: Returns a new rectangle with no position set.

member.summary: If true, then the rectangle is calculated on the fly, and the value of has no meaning.

member.summary: Rectangle where the element is. If is true, this rectangle has no meaning. Otherwise, the actual value of the coordinates of the rectangle depend on .

member.summary: What the means.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartPlotAreaPosition.RectangleStartsAtZero
member.summary: In Excel 2003 or older, there is a margin around the plot area where no data can go. So, a left of 0, meant to the start of the plot area + the margin. After Excel 2007 there is no margin anymore, and so you can place the plotarea at the actual 0 coordinates. If this property is false, it means the file was last saved by Excel 2003 and includes margins.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartTextOptions.Rotation
member.summary:
Text Rotation in degrees.
When this value is from 0 to 90 then this is the rotation degrees in the up direction.
When this value is from 91 to 180 then this is a rotation in the down direction. 91 means -1 degree rotation, 92 means -2 degrees, and so on until 180 which means -90 degrees.
255 is vertical text.
Other values are invalid.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartPlotArea.LayoutAsExcel2003
member.summary: When this property is true, this file was saved with Excel 2003 or older, and the layout of the chart is different. CoherentFlexCel uses this property to correctly render charts saved with Excel versions newer or older than Excel 2003. Note that for xlsx files this property is always false, but for charts in xls files it depends on what version of Excel was used to create the file.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartPlotArea.CalculatedPosition
member.summary: Returns the position that was last calculated by Excel, if that was saved in the file. Note that only xls files save the last calculated position, so in xlsx files this value will be empty.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TChartTitle
member.summary: Represents the title of the chart.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataLabel
member.summary: Represents one data label on the chart.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataLabel.PositionXls
member.summary:
Position of the label, assuming margins in the plot area. This value is only set in xls files, and has different meanings depending on the kind of label:
In titles, x and y are the offset from the chart position in units of 1/4000 of the position.
In axis titles, x means offset perpendicular to the axis, in units of 1/1000 of the plot-area bounding box, and y means offset parallel to the axis, in units of 1/1000 of the axis length.
In data labels for pie charts, x is the offset angle from the default, in degrees clockwise, while y is the radial offset, in units of 1/1000 of the pie radius.
In data labels for bar and column charts, x is the offset perpendicular to the bar or column, in units of 1/1000 of the plot area, while y is the offset parallel to the bar or column, in units of 1/1000 of the plot area.
For other charts, x is the horizontal offset from the default position, in units of 1/1000 of the plot area and y is vertical offset from the default position, in units of 1/1000 of the plot area.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataLabel.PositionZeroBased
member.summary: Coordinates in percent of the chart area. Different from this value has no margin attached. In old xls files, this value might not be set. If set, it should always be used instead of . Note that for titles and axis titles the height and width is always automatic. For data labels in xlsx files, you can specify a size.

member.summary: Formatting options for this label.

member.summary: Data options for the label.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapeProperties.TextFlags
member.summary: Option flags for the Text shape. Mask: 0x000E Horizontal text alignment: 1 = left-aligned 2 = centered 3 = right-aligned 4 = justified Mask: 0x0070 Vertical text alignment: 1 = top 2 = center 3 = bottom 4 = justify Mask: 0x0200 1 if the Lock Text option is on (Format Text Box dialog box, Protection tab)

member.summary: Text rotation, in degrees * 0xFFFF

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapeProperties.RotateTextWithShape

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapeProperties.ShapeOptions
member.summary: A lot of personalized settings, like shadow type fill color, line type, etc.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapeProperties.Anchor

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapeProperties.XlsxChartAnchor
member.summary: If the chart is inside a chart, this member can hold more exact information than .

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapeProperties.ShapeGeom
member.summary: Geometry of the shape, if it is an xlsx shape. Shapes in xls will have this value null. This property contains a parsed ShapeGeometry and it is used instead if it exists.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapeProperties.ShapeGeometry
member.summary: Geometry of the shape as XML, if it is an xlsx shape. Shapes in xls will have this value empty. You can find the XML string by creating the shape in Excel and opening the file with APIMate.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapeProperties.ShapeFill
member.summary: Fill of the shape, for xlsx shapes (even those which are saved in xls files). This property has a more complete description of the fill style than the one you can get by querying , but will be null for xls files saved by Excel 2003 or earlier.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapeProperties.ShapeLine
member.summary: Line of the shape, for xlsx shapes (even those which are saved in xls files). This property has a more complete description of the line style than the one you can get by querying , but will be null for xls files saved by Excel 2003 or earlier.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapeProperties.ShapeThemeFont
member.summary: Theme Font used for the text in the shape. This property only affects xlsx files, in xls font is always arial black, and you can change the font only inside the rich string, not in a global way. In xls files this will be null.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapeProperties.NestedOptions
member.summary: When the shape is a group, the real properties of the shape are in its first children. This method returns the correct shape options.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapeProperties.NestedAnchor
member.summary: Real Coordinates of the shape. Note that when the shape is a group, the value in is null and the real anchor is returned in the first child of the shape. This method will get the real Anchor of a first level object.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapeProperties.FlipH

member.summary: True if the shape is flipped vertically.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapeOptionList.GetGradientStopAlpha
member.summary: Returns a list of individual alpha values for the stops of a gradient. This is not available in xls files, only xlsx. The alpha values determine the opacity of each stop, with 0 being completely transparent and 255 being completely opaque. This value might be null if there is no gradient in the pattern, or if the individual stops don't have a defined alpha.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSgFormula
member.summary: specifies a formula used to calculate a value for use in a shape definition.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSgFormula.sgfSum
member.summary: Addition and subtraction. param1 + param2 - param3

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSgFormula.sgfProduct
member.summary: Multiplication and division. (param1*param2)/param3

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSgFormula.sgfMid
member.summary: Simple average. (param1+param2)/2

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSgFormula.sgfAbsolute
member.summary: Absolute value. abs(param1)

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSgFormula.sgfMin
member.summary: The lesser of two values. min(param1, param2)

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSgFormula.sgfMax
member.summary: The greater of two values. max(param1, param2)

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSgFormula.sgfIf
member.summary: Conditional selection. param1 > 0 ? param2 : param3

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSgFormula.sgfMod
member.summary: Modulus. sqrt(param1^2 + param2^2 + param3^2)

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSgFormula.sgfATan2
member.summary: Trigonometric arc tangent of a quotient. Angles in degrees, as 1616. atan2(param2,param1)

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSgFormula.sgfSin
member.summary: Sine. Angles in degrees, as 1616. param1*sin(param2)

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSgFormula.sgfCos
member.summary: Cosine. Angles in degrees, as 1616. param1*cos(param2)

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSgFormula.sgfCosATan2
member.summary: Cosine and atan2 in one formula. param1*cos(atan2(param3,param2))

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSgFormula.sgfSinATan2
member.summary: Sine and atan2 in one formula. param1*sin(atan2(param3,param2))

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSgFormula.sgfSqrt
member.summary: Square root. sqrt(param1)

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSgFormula.sgfSumAngle
member.summary: Angles in degrees as 1616. param1 + param2*2^16 + param3*2^16

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSgFormula.sgfEllipse
member.summary: The eccentricity formula for an ellipse, where param1 is the length of the semiminor axis and param2 is the length of the semimajor axis. param3*sqrt(1-(param1/param2)^2)

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSgFormula.sgfTan
member.summary: Angles in degrees, as 1616. param1*tan(param2)

member.summary: This method returns the brightness that results from applying tint to brightness.

Tint of the color (between -1 and 1)

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.THSLColor.GetTint(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Returns the tint needed to go from originalBrightness to newBrightness. A tint of 0 means no change (OriginalBrightness == NewBrightness), a tint of -1 means NewBrightness = 0, and a tint of 1 means NewBrightness = 1. So this method just does a simple interpolation to find out the needed tint.
This method is the inverse of
member.param: Brightness of the original color. (between 0 and 1)
Brightness of the new color that we want to produce by applying tint to originalBrightness/>
member.returns: The tint we need to apply to go from OriginalBrightness to NewBrigtness.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.THSLColor.DistanceSquared(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the distance between 2 colors. Not that this is not the euclidean distance, but a distance calculated to improve Hue matching. When converting cell colors, we try to preserve hues, so even a very pale red cell will be converted to bright red and not white or a very pale blue. This make it different from standard color matching as is done when adjusting images to a color palette, and where hue is not as important as here.

member.summary: Returns the CMC color distance between this color and color2 (distance returned is squared, so you need to get the sqrt if you want the real CMC value). Note that CMC is not symmetric (Color1.CMC(Color2) != Color2.CMC(Color1), so this color is the one used as reference.

L parameter for CMC calculation. For acceptability (CMC2:1) this is normally 2, and for perceptibility (CMC1:1) this should be 1.
C parameter for CMC calculation. This is normally 1.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of an Hyperlink class.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.THyperLink.#ctor(CoherentFlexCel.Core.THyperLinkType,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of an Hyperlink class.
member.param: The type of hyperlink: to a local file, to an url, to a cell or to a networked file.
Text of the HyperLink. This is empty when linking to a cell.
Description of the HyperLink.

When entering an URL on excel, you can enter additional text following the url with a "#" character (for example www.your_url.com#myurl") The text Mark is the text after the "#" char. When entering an address to a cell, the address goes here too.

Specifies the target frame that is to be used when opening this hyperlink. When the hyperlink is activated this attribute is used to determine if a new window is launched for viewing or if an existing one can be used.

When entering an URL on excel, you can enter additional text following the url with a "#" character (for example www.your_url.com#myurl") The text Mark is the text after the "#" char. When entering an address to a cell, the address goes here too.

Specifies the target frame that is to be used when opening this hyperlink. When the hyperlink is activated this attribute is used to determine if a new window is launched for viewing or if an existing one can be used.
Tooltip to be shown when hovering over the link.

member.summary: Condition used to apply the data validation.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataValidationInfo.FirstFormula
member.summary:
Formula for the first condition of the data validation. The text of the formula is limited to 255 characters. If is true, this formula can contain a list of values.
Note that with relative references, we always consider "A1" to be the cell where the data validation is. This means that the formula: "=$A$1 + A1" when evaluated in Cell B8, will read "=$A$1 + B8". To provide a negative offset, you need to wrap the formula. For example "=A1048575" will evaluate to B7 when evaluated in B8.
member.remarks:
If this formula refers to a cell range, you can get the cell range by calling .
To get the text for a particular cell, use .
To get the result of evaluating the formula, use

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataValidationInfo.SecondFormula
member.summary:
Formula for the second condition of the data validation, if it has two conditions. The text of the formula is limited to 255 characters.
Note that with relative references, we always consider "A1" to be the cell where the data validation is. This means that the formula: "=$A$1 + A1" when evaluated in Cell B8, will read "=$A$1 + B8". To provide a negative offset, you need to wrap the formula. For example "=A1048575" will evaluate to B7 when evaluated in B8.
member.remarks:
If this formula refers to a cell range, you can get the cell range by calling .
To get the text for a particular cell, use .
To get the result of evaluating the formula, use .

member.summary: When the parameter is a list, this property indicates whether to display a drop down box or not.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataValidationInfo.ExplicitList
member.summary: If true, contains a list of values. In this case, Formula1 must be a formula of the type: ="string", where string is a list of values separated by Character(0). For example, in C# Formula1 could be: ="Apples\0Lemmons\0Melons In Delphi.NET, Formula1 could be: '="Apples' + #0 + 'Lemmons' + #0 + 'Melons'

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataValidationIcon
member.summary: Icon to be displayed in the error box of a data validation action. Note that this not only affects the icon used, but the possible values. An information icon will allow you to enter an invalid value in a cell, a stop icon will not.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataValidationIcon.Stop
member.summary: Stop icon. ( a red circle with a cross). When selected, invalid values cannot be entered into the cell.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataValidationIcon.Warning
member.summary: Warning icon. ( a yellow triangle with an exclamation sign). When selected and there is an invalid entry, you get an error dialog allowing to cancel the operation, enter the invalid value anyway or re edit the cell.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataValidationIcon.Information
member.summary: Information icon. (a text ballon with an "i" inside). When selected and there is an invalid entry, a waning will be shown but the invalid data can be entered anyway.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataValidationImeMode
member.summary: The IME (input method editor) mode enforced by a data validation.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataValidationImeMode.NoControl
member.summary:
IME Mode Not Controlled.
Data validation does not control the IME control's mode.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataValidationImeMode.Off
member.summary:
IME Off.
Forces the IME control to be off when first selecting the cell (goes to direct cell input mode).

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataValidationImeMode.On
member.summary:
IME On.
Forces the IME control to be on when first selecting the cell.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataValidationImeMode.Disabled
member.summary:
IME mode is disabled.
Forces the IME control to be disabled when this cell is selected.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataValidationImeMode.Hiragana
member.summary:
Hiragana IME Mode.
Forces the IME control to be on and in Hiragana input mode when first selecting the cell. Applies when the application's language is Japanese and a Japanese IME control is selected

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataValidationImeMode.FullKatakana
member.summary:
Full Katakana IME Mode.
Forces the IME control to be on and in full-width Katakana input mode when first selecting the cell. Applies when the application's language is Japanese and a Japanese IME control is selected.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataValidationImeMode.HalfKatakana
member.summary:
Half-Width Katakana.
Forces the IME control to be on and in half-width Katakana input mode when first selecting the cell. Applies when the application's language is Japanese and a Japanese IME control is selected.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataValidationImeMode.FullAlpha
member.summary:
Full-Width Alpha-Numeric IME Mode.
Forces the IME control to be on and in full-width alpha-numeric input mode when the cell is first selected.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataValidationImeMode.HalfAlpha
member.summary:
Half Alpha IME.
Forces the IME control to be on and in half-width alpha-numeric input mode when the cell is first selected.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataValidationImeMode.FullHangul
member.summary:
Full Width Hangul.
Forces the IME control to be on and in full-width Hangul input mode when first selecting the cell. Applies when the application's language is Korean and a Korean IME control is selected.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataValidationImeMode.HalfHangul
member.summary:
Half-Width Hangul IME Mode.
Forces the IME control to be on and in half-width Hangul input mode when first selecting the cell. Applies when the application's language is Korean and a Korean IME control is selected.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.IUserDefinedFunctionAggregator
member.summary: This interface is passed to methods that will process the workbook. Implement your own custom decendant to create new functions.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.IUserDefinedFunctionAggregator.Process(System.Double,CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormulaErrorValue@)
member.summary:
Implement this method to do something for every value in the range.
Note: You can abort the processing (for example if there is an error) by returning false in this function, and the error value in the "error" parameter. But, Excel normally doesn't behave this way. Excel will normally first check all values to see if there is an error, and only then if no cell was a #Err! value, do other checks (for example negative parameters). So, for this to be 100% like Excel, you always need to return true in this function, and check for other errors only after all values have been processed. If you don't care about returning the exact error message Excel returns, you can return the error directly here while you are processing the values and speed up things (since other values won't be processed after you know the first error).
member.param: Value that will be processed.
Return an error here when the method returns false. If the method returns true, this parameter is undefined.
member.returns: False if you want to abort, true to continue.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUserDefinedFunctionScope
member.summary: Defines how custom functions are added to the recalculation engine. If a function is defined in both Global and Local scope, Local scope will be used.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUserDefinedFunctionScope.Global
member.summary: Function will be added for all instances of CoherentFlexCel. You will normally use this setting only once at the beginning of your application.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUserDefinedFunctionScope.Local
member.summary: Functions will be available only for the instance where they were added. Use this option if you might have different custom functions with the same name in different spreadsheets, and adding the function globally would clash. You will normally use this setting when adding the formulas after creating the ExcelFile instances.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUserDefinedFunctionLocation
member.summary: Defines where the custom function is located, if inside a macro in the same file, or inside a macro in an external file.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUserDefinedFunctionLocation.External
member.summary: The custom function is defined in an external file or addin. Whenever you add this function to a workbook, references will be created to an external function.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUserDefinedFunctionLocation.Internal
member.summary: The custom function is defined inside the same file where the formula is. Whenever you add this function to a workbook, references will be created to a macro in the same file.

Name that will be used when saving xls (biff8) files. Some functions are saved by Excel 2010 as .xlfn_Name when saving xls (not xlsx). This is the name that should be saved in the xls file, not the real name of the function.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUserDefinedFunction.Evaluate(CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUdfEventArgs,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Override this method to provide your own implementation on the function.
If this method throws an exception, it will not be handled and the recalculation will be aborted. So if you want to return an error, return a value.
Do not use any global variable in this method, it must be stateless and always return the same value when called with the same arguments.
See for more information.
member.param: Extra objects you can use to evaluate the function.

Parameters for the function. When this method is called by CoherentFlexCel, this parameter will never be null, but might be an array of zero length if there are no parameters.
Each parameter in the array will always be one of the following objects:
Null. (Nothing in VB). If the parameter is empty or missing.
A "System.Boolean"
A "System.String"
A "System.Double"
A This will be returned when the argument is a cell reference.
A . Except in very special cases (like an IsError function), the expected behavior in Excel is that whenever you get an Error parameter your function should return the same error and exit. You can use the method to implement that.
A 2-dimensional array of objects, where each object in the array will be of any of the types mentioned here again.
This class provides utility methods like that will help you get an specific type of object from a parameter.
member.returns: Return any object you want here. Normally a double, a string, a boolean a TFlxFormulaErrorValue or a null. If this method returns a class, it will be converted to an allowed value, normally to a string. If you want to return an array for an array formula, return a 2-dimensional array of objects (object[,]) where the elements of the array are the values you want to return.
member.example: See for examples.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelFileErrorActions
member.summary: Enumerates what to do on different CoherentFlexCel error situations.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelFileErrorActions.None
member.summary: CoherentFlexCel will try to recover from most errors.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelFileErrorActions.ErrorOnTooManyPageBreaks
member.summary: When true and the number of manual pagebreaks is bigger than the maximum Excel allows, an Exception will be raised. When false, the page break will be silently omitted. Note that This exception is raised when saving the file as xls, when you are exporting your report to PDF or images, all page breaks will be used.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelFileErrorActions.ErrorOnFormulaConstantTooLong
member.summary:
When true, CoherentFlexCel will complain when you try to set a formula that has a string constant bigger than 255 characters.
For example, the formula: '="very long string that has more than 255 characters...." & "other string" ' would raise an Exception, since Excel won't allow it. Note that you can still use ' =a1 & "other string" ' where the cell A1 has the value: "very long string that has more than 255 characters....". this restriction applies only to inline strings.
Note that when this property is false you will still get the error, but only when saving to xls, xlsx or other file formats that don't support longer strings. (this error is too important to be ignored)

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelFileErrorActions.ErrorOnRowHeightTooBig
member.summary: When true and the row height is bigger than the maximum allowed by Excel, you will get an Exception.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelFileErrorActions.ErrorOnXlsxInvalidName
member.summary: If this is true and the xlsx file contains an invalid name, an exception will be thrown.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelFileErrorActions.ErrorOnXlsxMissingPart
member.summary: If this is true and the xlsx file contains a missing part (like an image), an exception will be thrown.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelFileErrorActions.ErrorOnXlsxInvalidFormula
member.summary: If this is true and the file contains an invalid formula, an exception will be thrown.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelFileErrorActions.ErrorOnXlsxInvalidHyperlink
member.summary: If this is true and the file contains invalid hyperlinks, an exception will be thrown.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelFileErrorActions.All
member.summary: Sets all error actions together.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TWorkspace
member.summary:
This class links together a group of spreadsheets, so you can recalculate among linked spreadsheets. In order to use it, just define an object of this class and add all the files you need for the linked recalculation. If you don't know in advance which files you will need, you can use the event.
Note that whenever you recalculate any file in the workspace, all files will be recalculated, so you don't need to calculate them twice.
member.remarks: Files are case insensitive, even if running in Linux. "a.xls" is the same as "A.XLS"
member.example: If you have 3 files, xls1, xls2 and xls3, you can recalculate them together with the following code:

member.summary: Adds a file to the workspace. Whenever you recalculate any file in this workspace, all linked files will be recalculated too. Note that you can't add two files with the same name or same reference twice to this collection.
member.param: Name that this file will have in the workspace. When recalculating a linked formula, this name will be used. If you want to include paths in the name you can too, but it is normally not needed since CoherentFlexCel will search for the simple filename anyway. You only need to include paths if you have 2 files with the same name in different folders used in the recalculation.
Excel file to add.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.MathUtils.CalcFraction(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: This function won't find the best fraction approx, but it will find the convergents. Excel also finds the convergents, not the best approx, so to get the same as Excel, we won't try to find the best. For example, pi is: 3/1(*) , 13/4 , 16/5 , 19/6 , 22/7(*) , 179/57 , 201/64 , 223/71 , 245/78 , 267 /85 , 289 /92 , 311 / 99 , 333 /106(*) , 355 / 113 (*) , 52163 / 16604 , 52518 / 16717... where those marked with (*) are the ones we find. So for 2 digit denominator Excel will find 22/7, when the best fraction is 311/99. We will do the same. Look at Also note that 22/7 has better Hurwitz Accuracy than 311/99, and in that sense the continued fraction convergents are the best choice.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTableDefinition.ColumnFromName(System.String,CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelFile,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns the column definition for a given column name. If tableXls is null, then this method will return the stored column name. If not null and the table has headers, this method will try to get the column name from the cell value of the table headers in the Excel file.
If the column name doesn't exist, this method will return a TTableColumnDefinition(null, -1);
member.param: Column name which we want to find.

ExcelFile which contains the table. It can be null, and in this case the stored value of the header will be used. If not null, we will read the actual cell value in the file for the header, and return that.
Sheet where the table is inside tableXls (1 based).

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts
member.summary: Utility methods and constants usable anywhere.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.DefColWidthAdapt
member.summary:
OBSOLETE: Use instead.
Multiply by this number to convert the DEFAULT column width to pixels. This is different from , that goes in a column by column basis.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.ExcelVersion
member.summary: Defines the Excel mode used in this thread. Note that while on v2007 (the default) you still can make xls 97 spreadsheets, so the only reason to change this setting is if you have any compatibility issues (for example your code depends on a sheet having 65536 rows). IMPORTANT: Do NOT change this value after reading a workbook. Also, remember that the value is changed for all the reports in all threads.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.KeepMaxRowsAndColumnsWhenUpdating
member.summary: Defines what CoherentFlexCel will do when it finds a reference to the last row or column in an Excel 97-2003 spreadsheet, and it is upgrading to Excel 2007. If false (the default) row 65536 will be updated to row 1048576, and column 256 to column 16384. If true, references will stay the same. Note: This is a global property, so it affects all threads running.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.Max_Columns97_2003
member.summary: Maximum column on an xls (Excel 97 - 2003) spreadsheet. (0 based, that is 255)

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.Max_Columns2007
member.summary: Maximum column on an xlsx (Excel 2007 and up) spreadsheet. (0 based, that is 16383)

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.Max_Columns
member.summary:
Maximum column in the spreadsheet. (0 based). Note that this number is 1 less than the maximum column count, because this value is 0-based. You can use to get the number of columns instead.
This number might be 255 if is TExcelVersion.v97_2003 or 16383 otherwise.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.MaxRowCount
member.summary:
Returns the maximum number of rows that you can have in a spreadsheet. This is the same as + 1.
This number might be 65536 if is TExcelVersion.v97_2003 or 1048576 otherwise.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.MaxColCount
member.summary:
Returns the maximum number of columns that you can have in a spreadsheet. This is the same as + 1.
This number might be 256 if is TExcelVersion.v97_2003 or 16384 otherwise.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.Max_Rows97_2003
member.summary: Maximum row on an xls (Excel 97 - 2003) spreadsheet. (0 based, that is 65535)

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.Max_Rows95
member.summary: Maximum row on an xls (Excel 2 - 95) spreadsheet. (0 based)

member.summary: Maximum row on an xlsx (Excel 2007 and up) spreadsheet. (0 based, that is 1048575)

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.Max_Rows
member.summary:
Maximum row in the spreadsheet. (0 based). Note that this number is 1 less than the maximum row count, because this value is 0-based. You can use to get the number of columns instead.
This number might be 65535 if is TExcelVersion.v97_2003 or 1048575 otherwise.

Multiply by this number to convert the width of a column from pixels to excel internal units. Note that the default column width is different, you need to multiply by

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.RowMult
member.summary: Multiply by this number to convert pixels to excel row height units.
member.remarks: 1 Height unit= 1/20 pt. 1pt=1/72 inch. At 96ppi, 1 Height Unit= 96/(72*20)pixels -> 1 pix=(72*20)/96 = 15 Height units.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.DispMul
member.summary: Number of points in an inch.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.ColMultDisplay
member.summary:
OBSOLETE: Use instead.
Multiply by this number to convert the width of a column from GraphicsUnit.Display units (1/100 inch) to Excel internal units. Note that the default column width is different, you need to multiply by

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.RowMultDisplay
member.summary:
OBSOLETE: Use instead.
Multiply by this number to convert the height of a row from GraphicsUnit.Display units (1/100 inch) to Excel internal units.
member.remarks: 1 Height unit=1/20 pt. 1pt=1/72 inch. -> 1 Height unit=1/(72*20) inch. -> 1inch/100= 72*20/100= 14.4

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.ObjectPathSeparator
member.summary: String used to separate 2 objects on an object path.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.ObjectPathAbsolute
member.summary: When an objpath starts with this character, it is an absolute path that includes the object index. If it doesn't start with it, then the ObjPath doesn't include the original object.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.ObjectPathObjName
member.summary: When an objpath starts with this character, it is a path that goes directly to the name of an object. Note that when more than an object have the same name in the same sheet, this path won't work and you will have to use absolute or relative ones.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.ObjectPathSpId
member.summary: When an objpath starts with this character, what follows is a single shape id that identifies the object.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxConsts.MaxNestedCameraObjects
member.summary: When a camera object references an cell range that includes the camera object, there would be infinite recursion. This variable determines what is the maximum times that CoherentFlexCel will recurse when rendering the camera objects.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType
member.summary: Possible image types on an excel sheet.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType.Emf
member.summary: Enhanced Windows Metafile. This is a Vectorial image format.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType.Wmf
member.summary: Windows Metafile. This is a Vectorial image format.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType.Jpeg
member.summary: JPEG Image. This is a lossy compressed bitmap, best suited for photos.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType.Png
member.summary: Portable Network Graphics. This is a lossless compressed bitmap, best suited for text.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType.Bmp
member.summary: Windows Bitmap. As this is not compressed, don't use it except for really small images.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType.Pict
member.summary: Macintosh PICT. This won't be rendered by CoherentFlexCel, and you shouldn't add images in this format.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType.Tiff
member.summary: Tiff Image: This is NOT supported in xls file format, only xlsx.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType.Gif
member.summary: Gif Image. This is NOT supported in xls file format, only xlsx.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TXlsImgType.Unknown
member.summary: Unsupported image format.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSheetOptions
member.summary: General options for a sheet. In Excel, this settings are located in Tools->Options->View in the "Window options" box. Most of this options can be set with dedicated methods in , but this type allows to set them all at once, or copy them from other file. This options apply only to the active sheet. For options that apply to all the sheets see

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSheetOptions.None
member.summary: No option is selected.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSheetOptions.ShowFormulaText
member.summary: If 1, Excel will show formula text instead of formula results. This is the same as calling

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSheetOptions.ShowGridLines
member.summary: If 0 Excel will hide the gridlines, if 1 it will show them. This is the same as calling

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSheetOptions.ShowRowAndColumnHeaders
member.summary: if 0 Excel will hide the "A", "B"... column headers and "1", "2" ... row Headers. This is the same as calling

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSheetOptions.ZeroValues
member.summary: If 1 Excel will show formulas with result in 0 as 0. If not, Excel will show formulas that result in 0 as empty. This is the same as calling

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSheetOptions.AutomaticGridLineColors
member.summary: If 1, the color of gridlines will be gray. If 0 it will be the color specified at . Note that calling will automatically set this property to 0.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSheetOptions.RightToLeft
member.summary: If 1, the sheet is Right to left. This is the same as calling

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSheetOptions.OutlineSymbols
member.summary: If 1, Excel will show the outline symbols (+/-) when there are grouped rows or columns.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSheetOptions.PageBreakView
member.summary: If 1 Excel will show the page breaks.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSheetWindowOptions
member.summary: General options for how sheets display. In Excel, this settings are located in Tools->Options->View in the "Window options" box. This options apply only to all the sheets. For options that apply only to the active sheet see

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSheetWindowOptions.None
member.summary: No option is selected.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSheetWindowOptions.HideWindow
member.summary: If true, the workbook window will be hidden. You will need to go to Window->Unhide to see it.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSheetWindowOptions.MinimizeWindow
member.summary: If true, the workbok window will be minimized.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSheetWindowOptions.ShowHorizontalScrollBar
member.summary: If false, the horizontal scroll bar will be hidden.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSheetWindowOptions.ShowVerticalScrollBar
member.summary: If false, the vertical scroll bar will be hidden.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSheetWindowOptions.ShowSheetTabBar
member.summary: If false, the bar with sheet names at the bottom will be hidden.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged
member.summary: Specifies how a merged cell will be autofitted. For example, if you have a merged cell from row 1 to 4, You might want to increase the size of the first row, the second, the last, or every row a little.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.None
member.summary: Merged cells with more than one row will not be autofitted when autofitting rows, and merged cells with more than one column will not be autofitted when autofitting rows.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.OnLastCell
member.summary: Autofit will change the size of the last row of the merged cell when autofitting rows, or the last column when autofitting columns.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.OnLastCellMinusOne
member.summary: Autofit will change the size of the row before the last row of the merged cell when autofitting rows, or the column before the last column when autofitting columns.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.OnLastCellMinusTwo
member.summary: Autofit will change the size of 2 rows before the last row of the merged cell when autofitting rows, or 2 columns before the last column when autofitting columns.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.OnLastCellMinusThree
member.summary: Autofit will change the size of 3 rows before the last row of the merged cell when autofitting rows, or 3 columns before the last column when autofitting columns.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.OnLastCellMinusFour
member.summary: Autofit will change the size of 4 rows before the last row of the merged cell when autofitting rows, or 4 columns before the last column when autofitting columns.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.OnFirstCell
member.summary: Autofit will change the size of the first row of the merged cell when autofitting rows, or the first column when autofitting columns.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.OnSecondCell
member.summary: Autofit will change the size of the second row of the merged cell when autofitting rows, or the second column when autofitting columns.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.OnThirdCell
member.summary: Autofit will change the size of the third row of the merged cell when autofitting rows, or the third column when autofitting columns.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.OnFourthCell
member.summary: Autofit will change the size of the fourth row of the merged cell when autofitting rows, or the fourth column when autofitting columns.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.OnFifthCell
member.summary: Autofit will change the size of the fifth row of the merged cell when autofitting rows, or the fifth column when autofitting columns.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TAutofitMerged.Balanced
member.summary: Autofit will change the height every row in the merged cell by the same amount.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcludedRecords
member.summary: A list of records that might not be saved into a file when using

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcludedRecords.None
member.summary: This includes all records, including the write access. It is not recommended to use this setting, because write access will change every time you save a file with a different user.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcludedRecords.WriteAccess
member.summary: This is a stamp that is saved to the file each time it is saved, identifying the current user. You normally won't want to save this record, so you should specify this value.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcludedRecords.CellSelection
member.summary: If you specify CellSelection, the selected cells will be ignored.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcludedRecords.SheetSelected
member.summary: If you specify SheetSelected, the active sheet will be ignored.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcludedRecords.Version
member.summary: If you specify Version, the version of Excel used to save the file will be ignored. (Note that version might change in an Excel Service Pack).

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcludedRecords.All
member.summary: This excludes all records in this enumeration. This is the most recommended option.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TCollapseChildrenMode
member.summary: Determines how the children of the node of an outline will be when the node is collapsed or expanded.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TCollapseChildrenMode.DontModify
member.summary: Children nodes will be kept in the state they already were. If they were collapsed they will still be collapsed after collpasing or expanding the parent. Same if they were expanded.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TCollapseChildrenMode.Collapsed

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TPrintOptions
member.summary: How the sheet should be printed. You can mix value together by and'ing and or'ing the flags. See the example to see how to set or clear one specific value of the enumeration.
member.example:
Here we will show how to set the page orientation to landscape or portrait. You can do this simply by using
but if you wanted to do it with PrintOptions, you would do the following:

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TPrintOptions.None
member.summary: All options cleared.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TPrintOptions.LeftToRight
member.summary: Print over, then down

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TPrintOptions.Orientation
member.summary: 0= landscape, 1=portrait. You can change this by using xls.PrintLandscape.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TPrintOptions.NoPls
member.summary: if 1, then PaperSize, Scale, Res, VRes, Copies, and Landscape data have not been obtained from the printer, so they are not valid. MAKE SURE YOU MAKE THIS BIT = 0 *BEFORE* CHANGING ANY OTHER OPTION. THEY WILL NOT CHANGE IF THIS IS NOT SET.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TPrintOptions.NoColor
member.summary: 1= Black and white

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TPrintOptions.Draft
member.summary: 1= Draft quality

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TPrintOptions.Notes
member.summary: 1= Print Notes

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TPrintOptions.NoOrient
member.summary: 1=orientation not set

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TPrintOptions.UsePage
member.summary: 1=use custom starting page number.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.THidePrintObjects.Footers
member.summary: Do not print or export to pdf the Footers.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.THidePrintObjects.HeadersAndFooters
member.summary: Do not export headers nor footers. This is the same as specifying TPrintOptions.Headers and TPrintOptions.Footers.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.THidePrintObjects.PageBreaks
member.summary: Do not export page breaks. This property only applies to html exports.

member.summary: The cell indentation is made smaller when the print scale is smaller and vice-versa. This is the most logical setting, but it is not how Excel behaves. See

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TCellIndentationRendering.DontScaleIndentationWithPrintScale
member.summary: Keep the absolute value of cell indentation fixed in inches/cm when scaling the sheet. This is the mode in which CoherentFlexCel 6.23 and older behaved.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TCellIndentationRendering.DontScaleIndentationWithPrintScaleExceptWhenPrintHeadings
member.summary: Behaves like DontScaleIndentationWithPrintScale if "Print Headings" is false, and like ScaleIndentationWithPrintScale if "Print Headings" is true. This is how Excel behaves.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelVersion
member.summary: Defines which Excel version CoherentFlexCel is targeting. Note that while on v2007 you still can make xls 97 spreadsheets.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelVersion.v2007
member.summary: Excel 2007 and up. This version has a grid of 1048576 rows x 16384 columns.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelVersion.v97_2003
member.summary: Versions from Excel 97 to Excel 2003. Those versions have a grid limited by 65536 rows x 255 columns.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelFileFormat
member.summary: Different Excel versions create different empty xls/xlsx files. For example an empty xls file created by Excel 2003 will have "Arial" as its default font, and one created by Excel 2007 will have "Calibri". By default, when you call CoherentFlexCel will create a file that is similar to what Excel 2003 would create. This is fine, but if you want to start for example from an empty Excel 2007 file, you can do so by calling NewFile() with this enumeration.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelFileFormat.v2003
member.summary: Empty files will be created as if they were created by Excel 2003. The default font is Arial.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelFileFormat.v2007
member.summary: Empty files will be created as if they were created by Excel 2007. The default font is Calibri.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelFileFormat.v2010
member.summary: Empty files will be created as if they were created by Excel 2010. The default font is Calibri.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelFileFormat.v2013
member.summary: Empty files will be created as if they were created by Excel 2013. The default font is Calibri.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelFileFormat.v2016
member.summary: Empty files will be created as if they were created by Excel 2016. The default font is Calibri.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelFileFormat.v2019
member.summary: Empty files will be created as if they were created by Excel 2019. The default font is Calibri.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TXlsBiffVersion
member.summary: The specific Excel version that CoherentFlexCel will emulate when reading and saving files.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TXlsBiffVersion.Excel2007
member.summary: CoherentFlexCel will identify itself as Excel 2007 in the generated xls files.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TXlsBiffVersion.Excel2003
member.summary: CoherentFlexCel will identify itself as Excel 2003 in the generated xls files. It will also ignore the extra information written by Excel 2007 when reading xls files created with it.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFileFormats
member.summary: Supported file formats to read and write files.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFileFormats.Automatic
member.summary: Automatically detect the type of the file when opening files. If used when saving, CoherentFlexCel will choose whether to use xls or xlsx depending on the file extension (when saving to a file) or the value of when saving to a stream or when the format can't be determined from the extension.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFileFormats.Text
member.summary: Delimiter separated values. Depending on the delimiter, this can be csv, tab delimited text, etc.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFileFormats.Pxl
member.summary: Pocket Excel 1.0 or 2.0

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFileFormats.Xlsx
member.summary: Excel 2007 standard file format. Note that this is *not* a macro enabled file format. If you want to save a file with macros, you need to use Xlsm instead.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFileFormats.Xlsm
member.summary: Excel 2007 macro enabled file format.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRecalcMode
member.summary: Sets how the excel file will be recalculated. Normally CoherentFlexCel calculates a file only before saving and when you explicitly call . With this enum you can change that behavior.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRecalcMode.Smart
member.summary: The file will be recalculated before saving, *only* if there are any changes on the file. This mode is the recommended, because it allows you to open and save a file (for example to remove a password) without modifying the formula results. If you modify any value on the sheet, a recalculation will be done to get the new values.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRecalcMode.Forced
member.summary: The file will *always* be recalculated before saving. Use it if you are loading files that might not be recalculated, to make sure they will. If you open a not calculated file on Smart mode and then save it without modifying anything, it will remain not calculated.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRecalcMode.Manual
member.summary: The file will *never* be recalculated by CoherentFlexCel (Except if you do a forced recalc: XlsFile.Recalc(true). All formula results will be set to null and formulas will be modified so Excel recalculates them when you open the file. If you are only using Excel to open the generated files the result will be the same as with a recalculated file, but if you try to open it with a viewer you won't see the formula results. You should not need to use manual recalculation. The only case where it might be useful is if you are setting the formula results yourself and don't want CoherentFlexCel to change them when it saves.
member.remarks: Note that this mode is not related with "Manual Recalculation" in Excel. CoherentFlexCel always does "Manual" recalculation except when you use . It will only recalc when saving or explicitly calling Recalc(). In this "Manual" mode it will not even recalculate when you save or do a not-forced recalc.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRecalcMode.OnEveryChange
member.summary: The file will be recalculated each time a value changes on the sheet. Do not use this mode on normal files, as it can be really slow!! This option could be of use for an interactive viewer.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRecalcVersion
member.summary: Identifies how CoherentFlexCel will identify itself in the generated file, in order to recalculate.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRecalcVersion.AlwaysRecalc
member.summary: If you choose this option, Excel will always recalculate the full file on open, and ask for saving changes when closing the file.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRecalcVersion.SameAsInputFile
member.summary: CoherentFlexCel will write the same information that was in the original file it opened. Note that if you create a file with XlsFile.NewFile, then the version will be the version you specify in the NewFile parameters. By default, this is Excel 2003.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRecalcVersion.LatestKnownExcelVersion
member.summary: This will use the latest Excel version that CoherentFlexCel is aware of. Note that when you update CoherentFlexCel to a newer version, the recalculating version might change if it adds support for newer Excel versions.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRecalcVersion.Excel2003
member.summary: The file will be identified as if it was saved by Excel 2003. Any newer Excel version opening the file will recalculate the file on open, and ask to save changes when closing.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRecalcVersion.Excel2007
member.summary: The file will be identified as if it was saved by Excel 2007. Any newer Excel version opening the file will recalculate the file on open, and ask to save changes when closing.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRecalcVersion.Excel2010
member.summary: The file will be identified as if it was saved by Excel 2010. Any newer Excel version opening the file will recalculate the file on open, and ask to save changes when closing.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRecalcVersion.Excel2013
member.summary: The file will be identified as if it was saved by Excel 2013. Any newer Excel version opening the file will recalculate the file on open, and ask to save changes when closing.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRecalcVersion.Excel2016
member.summary: The file will be identified as if it was saved by Excel 2016. Any newer Excel version opening the file will recalculate the file on open, and ask to save changes when closing.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRecalcVersion.Excel2019
member.summary: The file will be identified as if it was saved by Excel 2019. Any newer Excel version opening the file will recalculate the file on open, and ask to save changes when closing.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxInsertMode
member.summary: Inserting mode. Important: This enumeration is also used when deleting ranges. When deleting, Down means Up and Right means Left.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxInsertMode.NoneDown
member.summary:
Cells will not be inserted but just overwrite existing ones. If count is >0, additional ranges will be copied down.
When deleting, this mode will clear the cells and not move anything.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxInsertMode.NoneRight
member.summary:
Cells will not be inserted but just overwrite existing ones. If count is >0, additional ranges will be copied right.
When deleting, this mode will clear the cells and not move anything.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxInsertMode.ShiftRowDown
member.summary:
Inserts whole rows. Moves all destination rows down.
When deleting, moves cells up.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxInsertMode.ShiftColRight
member.summary:
Inserts whole columns. Moves all destination columns to the right.
When deleting, moves columns to the right of the deleted columns to the left.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxInsertMode.ShiftRangeDown
member.summary:
Moves all destination cells down. This WON'T move the whole row, only cells on the range.
When deleting, moves cells up.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxInsertMode.ShiftRangeRight
member.summary:
Moves all destination cells to the right. This WON'T move the whole column, only cells on the range.
When deleting, moves cells to the left.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRangeCopyMode
member.summary: What we do with the cells when we call InsertAndCopyRange.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRangeCopyMode.All
member.summary: Will copy all (values, ranges, images, formulas, etc).

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRangeCopyMode.OnlyFormulas
member.summary: Will copy all except values. Useful when you are going to replace those values anyway.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRangeCopyMode.None
member.summary: Won't copy anything. Only inserts.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRangeCopyMode.OnlyFormulasAndNoObjects
member.summary: Will copy all except values and objects (like images). Useful when you are going to replace those values anyway.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRangeCopyMode.AllIncludingDontMoveAndSizeObjects
member.summary: Will copy all objects, including those that are marked as "do not copy" in the file. You will normally not want to use this.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRangeCopyMode.Formats
member.summary: Will copy cell formatting, but not cell contents. Images and objects will be copied too.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSortFormulaMode
member.summary: Defines how CoherentFlexCel will sort a range of cells, when you call XlsFile.Sort. You will normally want to specify "MoveFormulas", but for huge amounts of data where you know formulas won't matter, you might choose the "ExcelLike" mode. Note that Excel itself doesn't adapt correctly the formulas when sorting, and it works like the ExcelLike mode.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSortFormulaMode.MoveFormulas
member.summary: All formulas will remain pointing to the right places after the sort. This is the correct thing to do, and you will normally want to use this mode, unless it is too slow.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TSortFormulaMode.ExcelLike
member.summary: Formulas that are outside the range being sorted won't change. So if you are sorting for example the range A1:B10, and have a formula in A20: = A1, after sorting A20 will still be A1, and not reference the cell it used to reference. Formulas inside the range being sorted that point to different rows will not keep pointing to the same row. If for example in A1 you have =A2 and the sorting moves row 1 to 5, then the formula will be =A6, instead of pointing to the place where row 2 moved. This method is faster than the "MoveFormulas" approach, and it is the method Excel itself uses. If you don't have formulas pointing to other places in the row being moved, this method can be much faster.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TReferenceStyle
member.summary: Use this enumerator in the property to specify the reference mode that CoherentFlexCel will use when you enter formulas as text or when it returns the formula text.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TReferenceStyle.A1
member.summary: Standard A1 mode. Uses letters for the columns and numbers for the rows.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TReferenceStyle.R1C1
member.summary: R1C1 style. Uses numbers for both columns and rows.

member.summary: The list control is only allowed to have one selected item.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TListBoxSelectionType.Multi
member.summary: The list control is allowed to have multiple items selected by clicking on each item.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TListBoxSelectionType.Extend
member.summary: The list control is allowed to have multiple items selected by holding the CTRL key and clicking on each item.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TIgnoredErrors.CalculatedColumn
member.summary: Ignore errors when cells contain a formula different from the calculated column.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TIgnoredErrors.EmptyCellReference
member.summary: Ignore errors of formulas pointing to empty cell references.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TIgnoredErrors.EvalError

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TIgnoredErrors.Formula
member.summary: Ignore erors when a fomrula isn't similar to the other formulas in the region.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TIgnoredErrors.FormulaRange
member.summary: Ignore errors when a formula doesn't reference all cells in a range.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TIgnoredErrors.ListDataValidation
member.summary: Ignore errors when the cell value doesn't comply with the data validation rules.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TIgnoredErrors.NumberStoredAsText
member.summary: Ignore errors of numbers stored as text.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TIgnoredErrors.TwoDigitTextYear
member.summary: Ignore errors when formulas contain text formatted cells with years represented as 2 digits.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TIgnoredErrors.UnlockedFormula
member.summary: Ignore errors when unlocked cells contain formulas.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionType.WebQuery
member.summary: A Web Query.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionType.CustomOLEDB

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionType.Text
