member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionType.CustomADO
member.summary: Custom data connection source. This value is application-defined, but in Office it is used for ADO connections.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionType.CustomDSP
member.summary: Custom data connection source. This value is application-defined, but in Office it is used for DSP connections.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionReconnectionMethod
member.summary: How to reconnect when a connection fails.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionReconnectionMethod.Unknown
member.summary: Invalid value. This value shouldn't happen on a file.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionReconnectionMethod.AsRequired
member.summary: On refresh use the existing connection information. If the existing information cannot be used to establish a connection, get updated connection information, if available from the external connection file.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionReconnectionMethod.Always
member.summary: On every refresh get updated connection information from the external connection file, if available, and use that instead of the existing connection information. In this case the data refresh will fail if the external connection file is unavailable.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionReconnectionMethod.Never
member.summary: Never get updated connection information from the external connection file even if it is available and even if the existing connection information cannot be used.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionCredentialMethod
member.summary: Credentials method used for server access.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionCredentialMethod.Integrated
member.summary: Integrated authentication.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionCredentialMethod.None
member.summary: Use no credentials at all.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionCredentialMethod.Stored
member.summary: Use stored credentials.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionCredentialMethod.Prompt
member.summary: Prompt for credentials.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection
member.summary: This class represents one data connection on the workbook.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.DbProperties
member.summary: This element stores all properties associated with an ODBC or OLE DB external data connection.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.OlapProperties
member.summary: This element contains all the properties needed for an OLAP data connection. OLAP connections contain both the and TDataConnectionOlapProperties child elements.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.WebQueryProperties
member.summary: This element specifies the properties for a web query source. A web query will retrieve data from HTML tables, and can also supply HTTP "Get" parameters to be processed by the web server in generating the HTML by including the parameters and parameter elements.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.TextImportProperties
member.summary: This element contains all of the text import settings.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.Parameters
member.summary: This element stores properties about any parameters used with external data connections. Parameters are used to change the query executed externally and cause different data to be retrieved into the workbook.The type of parameter used determines whether the user is prompted for a value before data is refreshed, or the value is pulled from a cell in the workbook, or whether the same value should be used until explicitly changed in the data connection. Parameters are permitted for ODBC and web queries.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.ID
member.summary: Specifies The unique identifier of this connection.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.SourceFile
member.summary: Used when the external data source is file-based. When a connection to such a data source fails, the spreadsheet application attempts to connect directly to this file. Can be expressed in URI or system-specific file path notation.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.OdcFile
member.summary: Specifies the full path to external connection file from which this connection was created. If a connection fails during an attempt to refresh data, and ReconnectionMethod is AsRequired, then the spreadsheet application will try again using information from the external connection file instead of the connection object embedded within the workbook.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.KeepAlive
member.summary: True when the spreadsheet application should make efforts to keep the connection open.When false, the application should close the connection after retrieving the information.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.Interval
member.summary: Specifies the number of minutes between automatic refreshes of the connection. When this attribute is not present, the connection is not automatically refreshed.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.Name
member.summary: Specifies the name of the connection. Each connection shall have a unique name.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.Description
member.summary: Specifies the user description for this connection.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.ConnectionType
member.summary: Specifies the data source type.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.ReconnectionMethod
member.summary: Specifies what the spreadsheet application should do when a connection fails.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.RefreshedVersion
member.summary: For backward compatibility purposes, this attribute indicates the version of the spreadsheet application that last refreshed the connection.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.MinRefreshableVersion
member.summary: For compatibility with legacy spreadsheet applications. This represents the minimum version # that is required to be able to correctly refresh the data connection.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.SavePassword
member.summary: True if the password is to be saved as part of the connection string

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.IsNew
member.summary: True if the connection has not been refreshed for the first time. This can happen when the user saves the file before a query has finished returning.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.Deleted
member.summary: Indicates whether the associated workbook connection has been deleted. Deleted connections contain only the attributes name and deleted=true, all other information is removed when saving the file. If a new connection is created with the same name as a deleted connection, then the deleted connection is overwritten by the new connection.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.OnlyUseConnectionFile
member.summary:
Indicates whether the spreadsheet application should always and only use the connection information in the external connection file indicated by the odcFile attribute when the connection is refreshed. If false, then the spreadsheet application should follow the procedure indicated by the reconnectionMethod attribute.
Applies to ODBC connections, and may be applied to custom data connections.This attribute is ignored for other types of connections.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.SingleSignOnId
member.summary: Identifier for Single Sign On (SSO) used for authentication between an intermediate spreadsheetML server and the external data source.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.Credentials
member.summary: Specifies the authentication method to be used when establishing (or re-establishing) the connection.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.SaveData
member.summary: True if the external data fetched over the connection to populate a table is to be saved with the workbook; otherwise, false. This exists for data security purposes - if no external data is saved in (or "cached") in the workbook, then current user credentials can be required every time to retrieve the relevant data, and people won't see the data the workbook author had last been using before saving the file.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.RefreshOnLoad
member.summary: True if this connection should be refreshed when opening the file.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnection.Background

member.summary: Returns true if obj is the same as this object.

member.summary: Returns the hashcode of the object.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionDbProperties
member.summary: This element stores all properties associated with an ODBC or OLE DB external data connection.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionDbProperties.Connection
member.summary: The string used to initiate a session with a data source.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionDbProperties.Command
member.summary: The string containing the database command to pass to the data provider that will interact with the external source in order to retrieve data.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionDbProperties.ServerCommand
member.summary: Specifies a second command text string that is persisted when PivotTable server-based page fields are in use. For ODBC connections, serverCommand is usually a broader query than command(no WHERE clause is present in the former). Based on these 2 commands, parameter UI can be populated and parameterized queries can be constructed.

summary.para: Specifies the custom data source command type. Values are passed to the custom data source provider and their meaning might change depending on the provider.

For example, for OLEDB, the values can be: 1. Query specifies a cube name 2. Query specifies a SQL statement 3. Query specifies a table name 4. Query specifies that default information has been given, and it is up to the provider how to interpret. 5. Query is against a web based List Data Provider

member.summary: Returns true if both objects are the same.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionDbProperties.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hashcode of the object.

member.summary: This element contains all the properties needed for an OLAP data connection. OLAP connections contain both the and TDataConnectionOlapProperties child elements.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionOlapProperties.Local
member.summary: Flag indicating whether we should get data from the local cube on refresh versus the original data source. true if a local cube has been created for OLAP data, and it should be used instead of the server.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionOlapProperties.LocalConnection
member.summary: Specifies a connection string to use when a local cube is available. This is used when local is set to true.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionOlapProperties.LocalRefresh
member.summary: Flag indicating whether we should refresh the local cube from the original data source. When true, the original OLAP data source is queried each time the user explicitly refreshes the data in the application, and a new local cube is constructed from this query.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionOlapProperties.SendLocale
member.summary: When true, the spreadsheetML app should send the user interface locale ID to the OLAP provider to retrieve localized member names and properties, etc. When false, no locale ID is expected.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionOlapProperties.RowDrillCount
member.summary: Maximum number of drill-through rows to return when the user drills through an aggregate value in a PivotTable.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionOlapProperties.ServerFill
member.summary: When true a PivotTable based on an OLAP source should format the data and aggregate cells in the PivotTable view using the background color from the OLAP source if this information is available.When false, OLAP server background fill colors are ignored, and standard formatting rules within the worksheet are followed.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionOlapProperties.ServerNumberFormat
member.summary: When true, a PivotTable based on OLAP source should format the data and aggregate cells in the PivotTable view using the number format from the OLAP source.When false, OLAP server number formats are ignored, and standard formatting rules within the worksheet are followed.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionOlapProperties.ServerFont
member.summary: When true, a PivotTable based on OLAP source should format the data and aggregate cells in the PivotTable view using the font from the OLAP source (e.g., Arial or Tahoma). When false, OLAP server fonts are ignored, and standard formatting rules within the worksheet are followed.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionOlapProperties.ServerFontColor
member.summary: When true a PivotTable based on OLAP source should format the data and aggregate cells in the PivotTable view using the font color from the OLAP source.When false, OLAP server font colors are ignored, and standard formatting rules within the worksheet are followed.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties
member.summary: This element specifies the properties for a web query source. A web query will retrieve data from HTML tables, and can also supply HTTP "Get" parameters to be processed by the web server in generating the HTML by including the parameters and parameter elements.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.EditPage
member.summary: The URL of the user-facing web page showing the web query data. This URL is persisted in the case that sourceData = "true" and url has been redirected to reference an XML file. Then the user-facing page can be shown in the UI, and the XML data can be retrieved behind the scenes.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.HtmlFormat
member.summary: How to handle formatting from the HTML source when bringing web query data into the worksheet. Relevant when SourceData is True.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.HtmlTables
member.summary: Flag indicating whether web queries should only work on HTML tables.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.Post
member.summary: Returns or sets the string used with the post method of inputting data into a web server to return data from a web query.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.Url
member.summary: URL to use to refresh external data.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.Xl2000
member.summary: This flag exists for backward compatibility with older existing spreadsheet files, and is set to true if this web query was refreshed in a spreadsheet application newer than or equal to Microsoft Excel 2000. This is an optional attribute that can be ignored.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.TextDates
member.summary: Flag indicating whether dates should be imported into cells in the worksheet as text rather than dates.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.Xl97
member.summary: This flag exists for backward compatibility with older existing spreadhseet files, and is set to true if this web query was created in Microsoft Excel 97. This is an optional attribute that can be ignored.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.FirstRow
member.summary: Flag indicating whether to parse all tables inside a PRE block with the same width settings as the first row.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.ConsecutiveDelimiters
member.summary: Flag indicating whether consecutive delimiters should be treated as just one delimiter.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionWebQueryProperties.ParsePre
member.summary: Flag indicating whether data contained within HTML <PRE> tags in the web page is parsed into columns when you import the page into a query table.

member.summary: Flag indicating that XML source data should be imported instead of the HTML table itself.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties
member.summary: This element contains all of the text import settings.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.TextFields
member.summary: Field definitions. This property is never null, and by modifying it you modify the parent TextImportProperties too.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.PromptForFileName
member.summary: Flag indicating whether the user wants to be prompted for the file name on refresh. If false, then the user is not prompted.If true or not present, then the user is prompted.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.FileType
member.summary: Ignorable attribute. Determines the kind of character set to use during import. Only one of FileType and CharacterSet or CodePage shall be specified.

summary.para: Name of the character set associated with the text file. Values for this attribute are restricted to the names and aliases listed in the IANA CHARACTER SETS listing found at http://www.iana.org/assignments/character-sets.
If this attribute is not present then the CodePage attribute is used.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.FirstRow
member.summary: Indicates at what row of the file to start the data import. All unsignedInt values are permitted, although it's possible that firstRow is higher than the number of rows in the text file, in which case no data is imported.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.SourceFile
member.summary: Path to the text file to use to import external data. Can be expressed in URI or systemspecific file path notation.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.IsDelimited
member.summary: True if the file is Tab or character delimited. false if the file should be parsed according to fixed length fields.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.DecimalSeparator
member.summary: The decimal separator character. This and the thousands attribute are used only when data in the text file contains decimal and thousands separators that are different from those used on the computer, due to a different language setting being used.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.ThousandsSeparator
member.summary: The thousands separator character. This and the decimal attribute are used only when data in the text file contains decimal and thousands separators that are different from those used on the computer, due to a different language setting being used.Please refer to the decimal attribute description above for a Table describing the behavior. Strings values of this attribute are expected to be one character in length.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.TabIsDelimiter
member.summary: Flag indicating whether to treat tab characters as field delimiters. If false, then tabs will not be used as delimiters.If true or not present, then they are used as delimiters.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.SpaceIsDelimiter
member.summary: Flag indicating whether to treat space characters as field delimiters.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.CommaIsDelimiter
member.summary: Flag indicating whether to treat comma characters as field delimiters.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.SemicolonIsDelimiter
member.summary: Flag indicating whether to treat semicolon characters as field delimiters.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.ConsecutiveDelimiters
member.summary: Flag indicating whether consecutive delimiters should be treated as just one delimiter. If this flag is true than it's possible or even likely that some rows will return more fields than others, and these fields will always fill cells in the worksheet from left to right.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.Qualifier
member.summary: Character used as the text string qualifier.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionTextImportProperties.Delimiter
member.summary: User-specified character to be treated as a field delimiter. Only single characters are supported.

member.summary: Returns true if both objects are the same.

member.summary: Returns the hashcode of the object.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionParameter
member.summary: This element stores properties about any parameters used with external data connections. Parameters are used to change the query executed externally and cause different data to be retrieved into the workbook.The type of parameter used determines whether the user is prompted for a value before data is refreshed, or the value is pulled from a cell in the workbook, or whether the same value should be used until explicitly changed in the data connection. Parameters are permitted for ODBC and web queries.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionParameter.Name
member.summary: The name of the parameter.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionParameter.SqlType
member.summary: SQL data type of the parameter. This attribute is only supported for ODBC data sources. For more information, including supported data types, see ISO 9075-3:2008, Table 33 - Codes used for concise data types.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionParameter.ParameterType
member.summary: Type of parameter used. If the parameterType=value, then the value from , , , or are used.In this case, it is expected that only one of those properties is specified.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionParameter.RefreshOnChange
member.summary: Flag indicating whether the query should automatically refresh when the contents of a cell that provides the parameter value changes. If true, then external data is refreshed using the new parameter value every time there's a change. If false, then external data is only refreshed when requested by the user, or some other event triggers refresh (e.g., workbook opened).

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionParameter.Prompt
member.summary: Prompt string for the parameter. Presented to the spreadsheet user along with input UI to collect the parameter value before refreshing the external data.Used only when = prompt.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionParameter.AsBoolean
member.summary: Boolean value to use as the query parameter. Used only when = value.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionParameter.AsDouble
member.summary: Non-integer numeric value to use as the query parameter. Used only when = value.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionParameter.AsInteger
member.summary: Integer value to use as the query parameter. Used when = value.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionParameter.AsString
member.summary: String value to use as the query parameter. Used only when = value.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDataConnectionParameter.AsCell
member.summary: Cell reference indicating which cell's value to use for the query parameter. Used only when = cell.

member.summary: Returns true if both objects are the same.

member.summary: Returns the hashcode of the object.

member.summary: Revision number. (Standard property). Note:While this is a string and Windows Explorer will allow you to set any value here, Excel will report any file with a revision which is not an integer as invalid.

member.summary: Date of created in UTC time. (Standard property). Note: Unless you set this property explicitly, CoherentFlexCel will save the current time as the creation date. If you are creating a new file this is what you want. But if you are modifying and existing file and want to preserve the original creation date, you need to explicitly set ths property.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TPropertyId.HeadingPairs
member.summary: Internally used property indicating the grouping of different document parts and the number of items in each group. The titles of the document parts are stored in the TitlesofParts property. The HeadingPairs property is stored as a vector of variants, in repeating pairs of VT_LPSTR (or VT_LPWSTR) and VT_I4 values. The VT_LPSTR value represents a heading name, and the VT_I4 value indicates the count of document parts under that heading. (Extended property)

member.summary: Names of document parts. (Extended property)

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties
member.summary: Properties for an Excel sheet.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties.#ctor(CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelFile)
member.summary: Creates a new TDocumentProperties instance and initializes it.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties.GetStandardProperty(CoherentFlexCel.Core.TPropertyId)
member.summary:
Returns a standard document property (Like Author, Title, etc.). This method returns an object that might be:
null: If the property is not assigned.
Int16, Int32, Int64, Single, Double, Decimal: If the property is a number.
DateTime: If the property is a Date or a DateTime.
String: If the property is a string.
Boolean: If the property is a boolean.
An array of byte (byte[]): If the property is a Blob.
An array of object (object[]): If the property is an array. Each one of the members of the array must be of one of the types specified here.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties.GetUsedStandardProperties(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a list of all the standard properties that are set.
member.param: If true, only the properties that you can set will be returned.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties.SetStandardProperty(CoherentFlexCel.Core.TPropertyId,System.String)
member.summary: This method only works in xlsx files. It will set the standard property with the given Id to the specified value. Set the value to null or empty to clear the property.
member.param: Property id that we want to modify.
Set it to null or empty to clear the property.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties.GetCustomProperty(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a custom property with a given name.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties.SetCustomProperty(System.String,CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDocumentCustomPropertyType,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method only works in xlsx files. Sets a custom property with a given name. Set the value to null or empty string to remove the property.
member.param: Name of the custom property you want to create or modify.
Type of the property (boolean, string, etc.)
Value for the property. Note that while it is a string, it must be convertible to the type you are specifying. Doubles should use "." as decimal separators.
Numeric Id for the property. This value must be unique and bigger or equal to 2.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties.GetAllCustomProperties
member.summary: Returns a list of all the names of custom properties in the file.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties.RemoveAllProperties
member.summary: This method will remove all document properties of the file. You can use it to be sure you aren't embedding any confidential information on the properties.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties.PreserveCreationDate
member.summary: By default CoherentFlexCel will set the creation date in the file to be the date when you actually created it, no matter the value originally stored in the file. This assumes you are starting from a template and generating a new document from it. But if you are modifying an existing file and want to preserve the original creation date, then you need to set this property to true. Note that this property sets itself automatically to true if you manually set the creation time of a file.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDocumentProperties.PreserveModifiedDate
member.summary: By default CoherentFlexCel will set the modified date in the file to be the date when you actually saved it, no matter the value originally stored in the file. But if you need to set a different modified date than the date in the server, or you don't want a new modified date to be saved and preserve the one in the document, then you need to set this property to true. If you are setting this property to true, you probably also want to set to true. Note that this property sets itself automatically to true if you manually set the modified time of a file.

member.summary: Represents a Color for a drawing or a theme. Different from TExcelColor, this structure is defined in terms of DrawingML, not SpreadsheetML.

member.summary: Identifies which kind of color is the one to apply in this structure.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingColor.HSL
member.summary:
Returns the color when this structure has an HSL color, as a 0xHHSSLL integer.
If you try to read the value of this property and is not the right kind, an Exception will be raised.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingColor.RGB
member.summary:
Returns the color when this structure has an RGB color, as a 0xRRGGBB integer.
If you try to read the value of this property and is not the right kind, an Exception will be raised.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingColor.ScRGB
member.summary:
Returns the color when this structure has an scRGB color.
If you try to read the value of this property and is not the right kind, an Exception will be raised.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingColor.Preset

Returns the color when this structure has a Preset color.
If you try to read the value of this property and is not the right kind, an Exception will be raised.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingColor.System
member.summary:
Returns the color when this structure has a System color.
If you try to read the value of this property and is not the right kind, an Exception will be raised.

If you try to read the value of this property and is not the right kind, an Exception will be raised.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType
member.summary: List of transformations that can be done to a color.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Tint
member.summary: Yields a lighter version of its input color. A 10% tint is 10% of the input color combined with 90% white.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Shade
member.summary: Yields a darker version of its input color. A 10% shade is 10% of the input color combined with 90% black.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Complement
member.summary: Yields the complement of its input color. For example, the complement of red is green.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Inverse
member.summary: Yields the inverse of its input color. For example, the inverse of red (1,0,0) is cyan (0,1,1).

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Gray
member.summary: Yields a grayscale of its input color, taking into relative intensities of the red, green, and blue primaries.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Alpha
member.summary: Yields its input color with the specified opacity, but with its color unchanged.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.AlphaOff
member.summary: Yields a more or less opaque version of its input color. An alpha offset never increases the alpha beyond 100% or decreases below 0%; i.e., the result of the transform pins the alpha to the range of [0%,100%]. A 10% alpha offset increases a 50% opacity to 60%. A -10% alpha offset decreases a 50% opacity to 40%.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.AlphaMod
member.summary: Yields a more or less opaque version of its input color. An alpha modulate never increases the alpha beyond 100%. A 200% alpha modulate makes a input color twice as opaque as before. A 50% alpha modulate makes a input color half as opaque as before.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Hue
member.summary: Yields the input color with the specified hue, but with its saturation and luminance unchanged.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.HueOff
member.summary: Yields the input color with its hue shifted, but with its saturation and luminance unchanged.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.HueMod
member.summary: Yields the input color with its hue modulated by the given percentage.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Sat
member.summary: Yields the input color with the specified saturation, but with its hue and luminance unchanged. Typically saturation values fall in the range [0%, 100%].

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.SatOff
member.summary: Yields the input color with its saturation shifted, but with its hue and luminance unchanged.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.SatMod
member.summary: Yields the input color with its saturation modulated by the given percentage. A 50% saturation modulate reduces the saturation by half. A 200% saturation modulate doubles the saturation.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Lum
member.summary: Yields the input color with the specified luminance, but with its hue and saturation unchanged. Typically, luminance values fall in the range [0%,100%].

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.LumOff
member.summary: Yields the input color with its luminance shifted, but with its hue and saturation unchanged.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.LumMod
member.summary: Yields the input color with its luminance modulated by the given percentage. A 50% luminance modulate reduces the luminance by half. A 200% luminance modulate doubles the luminance.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Red
member.summary: Yields the input color with the specified red component, but with its green and blue components unchanged.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.RedOff
member.summary: Yields the input color with its red component shifted, but with its green and blue components unchanged.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.RedMod
member.summary: Yields the input color with its red component modulated by the given percentage. A 50% red modulate reduces the red component by half. A 200% red modulate doubles the red component.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Green
member.summary: Yields the input color with the specified green component, but with its red and blue components unchanged.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.GreenOff
member.summary: Yields the input color with its green component shifted, but with its red and blue components unchanged.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.GreenMod
member.summary: Yields the input color with its green component modulated by the given percentage. A 50% green modulate reduces the green component by half. A 200% green modulate doubles the green component.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Blue
member.summary: Yields the input color with the specified blue component, but with its red and green components unchanged.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.BlueOff
member.summary: Yields the input color with its blue component shifted, but with its red and green components unchanged.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.BlueMod
member.summary: Yields the input color with its blue component modulated by the given percentage. A 50% blue modulate reduces the blue component by half. A 200% blue modulate doubles the blue component.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.Gamma
member.summary: Yields the sRGB gamma shift of its input color.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TColorTransformType.InvGamma
member.summary: Yields the inverse sRGB gamma shift of its input color.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the alignment types for text in a drawing.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingAlignment.Left
member.summary: Align text to the left margin.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingAlignment.Center
member.summary: Align text in the center.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingAlignment.Right
member.summary: Align text to the right margin.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingAlignment.Justified
member.summary: Align text so that it is justified across the whole line. It is smart in the sense that it does not justify sentences which are short.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingAlignment.JustLow
member.summary: Aligns the text with an adjusted kashida length for Arabic text.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingAlignment.Distributed
member.summary: Distributes the text words across an entire text line.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingAlignment.ThaiDist
member.summary: Distributes Thai text specially, because each character is treated as a word.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingFontAlign
member.summary: Different types of font alignment.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingFontAlign.Automatic
member.summary: When the text flow is horizontal or simple vertical same as fontBaseline but for other vertical modes same as fontCenter.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingFontAlign.Top
member.summary: The letters are anchored to the top baseline of a single line.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingFontAlign.Center
member.summary: The letters are anchored between the two baselines of a single line.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingFontAlign.BaseLine
member.summary: The letters are anchored to the bottom baseline of a single line.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingFontAlign.Bottom
member.summary: The letters are anchored to the very bottom of a single line. This is different than the bottom baseline because of letters such as "g," "q," "y," etc.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle
member.summary: Possible underline types in a drawing.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.None
member.summary: No underline.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.Words
member.summary: Underline just the words and not the spaces between them.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.Single
member.summary: Underline the text with a single line of normal thickness.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.Double
member.summary: Underline the text with two lines of normal thickness.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.Heavy
member.summary: Underline the text with a single, thick line.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.Dotted
member.summary: Underline the text with a single, dotted line of normal thickness.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.DottedHeavy
member.summary: Underline the text with a single, thick dotted line.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.Dash
member.summary: Underline the text with a single, dashed line of normal thickness.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.DashHeavy
member.summary: Underline the text with a single, thick dashed line.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.DashLong
member.summary: Underline the text with a single line of normal thickness consisting of long dashes.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.DashLongHeavy
member.summary: Underline the text with a single thick line consisting of long dashes.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.DotDash
member.summary: Underline the text with a single line consisting of alternating dots and dashes of normal thcikness.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.DotDashHeavy
member.summary: Underline the text with a single thick line consisting of alternating dots and dashes.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.DotDotDash
member.summary: Underline the text with a single line of normal thickness consisting of repeating two dots and dashes.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.DotDotDashHeavy
member.summary: Underline the text with a single thick line consisting of repeating two dots and dashes.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.Wavy
member.summary: Underline the text with a single wavy line of normal thickness.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.WavyHeavy
member.summary: Underline the text with a single, thick wavy line.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingUnderlineStyle.WavyDouble
member.summary: Underline the text with two wavy lines of normal thickness.

member.summary: How the text is stroke out.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextStrike.None
member.summary: No strike is applied to the text.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextStrike.Single
member.summary: A single strike is applied to the text.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextStrike.Double

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextCapitalization
member.summary: how text is capitalized when rendered.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextCapitalization.None
member.summary: No capitalization.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextCapitalization.Small
member.summary: Apply small caps to the text. All letters are converted to lower case.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextCapitalization.All
member.summary: Apply all caps on the text. All lower case letters are converted to upper case even though they are stored differently in the backing store.

member.summary: Specifies the indent size that is applied to the first line of text in the paragraph. An indentation of 0 is considered to be at the same location as marL attribute.

member.summary: Specifies the alignment that is to be applied to the paragraph.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingParagraphProperties.DefTabSz
member.summary: Specifies the default size for a tab character within this paragraph. This attribute should be used to describe the spacing of tabs within the paragraph instead of a leading indentation tab. For indentation tabs there are the marL and indent attributes to assist with this.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingParagraphProperties.Rtl
member.summary: Specifies whether the text is right-to-left or left-to-right in its flow direction. If null, the value is not known.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingParagraphProperties.EaLnBrk
member.summary: Specifies whether an East Asian word can be broken in half and wrapped onto the next line without a hyphen being added.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingParagraphProperties.FontAlgn
member.summary: Determines where vertically on a line of text the actual words are positioned. This deals with vertical placement of the characters with respect to the baselines.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingParagraphProperties.LatinLnBrk
member.summary: Specifies whether a Latin word can be broken in half and wrapped onto the next line without a hyphen being added.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingParagraphProperties.HangingPunct
member.summary: Specifies whether punctuation is to be forcefully laid out on a line of text or put on a different line of text.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextProperties.Latin
member.summary: This element specifies that a Latin font be used for a specific run of text. This font is specified with a typeface attribute much like the others but is specifically classified as a Latin font.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextProperties.EastAsian
member.summary: This element specifies that an East Asian font be used for a specific run of text. This font is specified with a typeface attribute much like the others but is specifically classified as an East Asian font.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextProperties.ComplexScript
member.summary: This element specifies that a complex script font be used for a specific run of text. This font is specified with a typeface attribute much like the others but is specifically classified as a complex script font.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextProperties.Symbol
member.summary: This element specifies that a symbol script font be used for a specific run of text. This font is specified with a typeface attribute much like the others but is specifically classified as a symbol script font.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextProperties.HyperlinkClick
member.summary: Specifies the on-click hyperlink information to be applied to a run of text. When the hyperlink text is clicked the link is fetched.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextProperties.HyperlinkMouseOver
member.summary: Specifies the mouse-over hyperlink information to be applied to a run of text. When the mouse is hovered over this hyperlink text the link is fetched.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextProperties.RightToLeft
member.summary: This element specifies whether the contents of this run shall have right-to-left characteristics.

member.summary: Group of simple attributes applied to the text run.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes
member.summary: Group of simple attributes for text properties.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Empty
member.summary: Returns the text attributes with the default values.
Creates a new instance.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Kumimoji
member.summary: Specifies whether the numbers contained within vertical text continue vertically with the text or whether they are to be displayed horizontally while the surrounding characters continue in a vertical fashion. A null value means to use the parent's settings.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Lang
member.summary: Specifies the language to be used when the generating application is displaying the user interface controls.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.AltLang
member.summary: Specifies the alternate language to use when the generating application is displaying the user interface controls.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Size
member.summary: Specifies the size of text within a text run. Whole points are specified in increments of 100 starting with 100 being a point size of 1. For instance a font point size of 12 would be 1200 and a font point size of 12.5 would be 1250. A null value means to use the parent's settings.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Bold
member.summary: Specifies whether a run of text is formatted as bold text. A null value means to use the parent's settings, while false means always that the text is not bold, no matter if it was inside a bold paragraph.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Italic
member.summary: Specifies whether a run of text is formatted as italic text. A null value means to use the parent's settings.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Underline
member.summary: Specifies whether a run of text is formatted as underlined text. A null value means to use the parent's settings.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Strike
member.summary: Specifies whether a run of text is formatted as strikethrough text. A null value means to use the parent's settings.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Kern
member.summary: Specifies the minimum font size at which character kerning occurs for this text run. Whole points are specified in increments of 100 starting with 100 being a point size of 1. For instance a font point size of 12 would be 1200 and a font point size of 12.5 would be 1250. A null value means to use the parent's settings.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Capitalization
member.summary: Specifies the capitalization that is to be applied to the text run. This is a render-only modification and does not affect the actual characters stored in the text run. This attribute is also distinct from the toggle function where the actual characters stored in the text run are changed. A null value means to use the parent's settings.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Spacing
member.summary: Specifies the spacing between characters within a text run. This spacing is specified numerically and should be consistently applied across the entire run of text by the generating application. Whole points are specified in increments of 100 starting with 100 being a point size of 1. For instance a font point size of 12 would be 1200 and a font point size of 12.5 would be 1250. A null value means to use the parent's settings.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.NormalizeH
member.summary: Specifies the normalization of height that is to be applied to the text run. This is a render- only modification and does not affect the actual characters stored in the text run. This attribute is also distinct from the toggle function where the actual characters stored in the text run are changed. A null value means to use the parent's settings.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Baseline
member.summary: Specifies the baseline for both the superscript and subscript fonts. A null value means to use the parent's settings.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.NoProof
member.summary: Specifies that a run of text has been selected by the user to not be checked for mistakes. A null value means to use the parent's settings.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Dirty
member.summary: Specifies that the content of a text run has changed since the proofing tools have last been run.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.Err
member.summary: Specifies that when this run of text was checked for spelling, grammar, etc. that a mistake was indeed found.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.SmartTagClean
member.summary: Specifies whether or not a text run has been checked for smart tags.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.SmartTagId
member.summary: Specifies a smart tag identifier for a run of text. This ID is unique throughout the presentation and is used to reference corresponding auxiliary information about the smart tag.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingTextAttributes.BookmarkLinkTarget
member.summary: Specifies the link target name that is used to reference to the proper link properties in a custom XML part within the document.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingHyperlink
member.summary: Specifies an hyperlink in a drawing. While this class is similar to THyperlink for links in cells, it has some differences.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingHyperlink.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new hyperlink for a drawing.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingHyperlink.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new hyperlink for a drawing.
member.param: Url for the link (including the prefix like "file:///")
If blank then a new window will be used.
Tooltip to show when the user hovers over the hyperlink.
Specifies an action that is to be taken when this hyperlink is activated. This can be used to specify a slide to be navigated to or a script of code to be run. Doesn't seem to be used in Excel.
When set to true, the link will be painted in a "Visited" color.
If true, the link will be added to the history.
If true, any sound currently playing will be stopped when you click the link.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingHyperlink.Url
member.summary: Url for the link (including the prefix like "file:///")

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingHyperlink.TargetFrame
member.summary: If blank then a new window will be used.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingHyperlink.Hint
member.summary: Tooltip to show when the user hovers over the hyperlink.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingHyperlink.Action
member.summary: Specifies an action that is to be taken when this hyperlink is activated. This can be used to specify a slide to be navigated to or a script of code to be run. Doesn't seem to be used in Excel.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingHyperlink.HighlightClick
member.summary: When set to true, the link will be painted in a "Visited" color.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingHyperlink.AddToHistory

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ImageUtils.GetJPEGOrientation(System.Byte[])
member.summary: This function returns the orientation specific to a JPEG file. CoherentFlexCel will automatically rotate the images you add with AddImage (same as Excel does), but it will not rotate the images you enter in the headers/footers or if you replace an existing image. In those cases, you can use this method to know if the image needs to be rotated before entering it.
member.param: Image data.
member.returns: Orientation of the JPEG file.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TThemeColor.Background1
member.summary: Primary semantic color for the background. This color isn't a real theme color and normally it is mapped to . In cells it doesn't matter what you use: Background1 or Light1 as both are mapped internally to Light1. But in drawings Excel allows both types of themes even if they normally are the same.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TThemeColor.Foreground1
member.summary: Primary semantic color for the foreground. This color isn't a real theme color and normally it is mapped to . In cells it doesn't matter what you use: Forground1 or Dark1 as both are mapped internally to Dark1. But in drawings Excel allows both types of themes even if they normally are the same.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TThemeColor.Background2
member.summary: Secondary semantic color for the background. This color isn't a real theme color and normally it is mapped to . In cells it doesn't matter what you use: Background2 or Light2 as both are mapped internally to Light2. But in drawings Excel allows both types of themes even if they normally are the same.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TThemeColor.Foreground2
member.summary: Secondary semantic color for the foreground. This color isn't a real theme color and normally it is mapped to . In cells it doesn't matter what you use: Forground2 or Dark2 as both are mapped internally to Dark2. But in drawings Excel allows both types of themes even if they normally are the same.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelColor
member.summary: Represents an Excel color. Colors in Excel can be defined in four ways: Automatic Colors, Indexed Colors (for compatibility with Excel 2003 or older), Palette colors, and RGB colors. This Structure is immutable, once you create it you cannot change its members. You need to create a new struct to modify it.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelColor.ColorType
member.summary: Identifies which kind of color is the one to apply in this structure.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelColor.RGB
member.summary:
Returns the color when this structure has an RGB color, as a 0xRRGGBB integer. This property is fully functional with Excel 2007 or newer, older versions will be converted to Indexed color before saving as xls.
Note: When reading a color, the value here might not be the final one, since is applied to get the final color. Use method to find out the RGB color stored in this struct.
If you try to read the value of this property and is not the right kind, an Exception will be raised.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelColor.AutomaticFillType
member.summary: Returns the type of automatic color, if this structure contains an automatic color.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelColor.Index
member.summary:
Returns the color when this structure contains an indexed color (1 based). This property is for compatibility with xls files (Excel 2003 or older), but if you are not changing the color palette, even for older files, it is preferred to use or instead.
If you try to read the value of this property and is not the right kind, an Exception will be raised.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelColor.Theme
member.summary:
Returns the color if it is one of the entries in the theme palette (1 based).
If you try to read the value of this property and is not the right kind, an Exception will be raised.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelColor.Tint
member.summary:
Returns the tint value applied to the color.
If tint is supplied, then it is applied to the RGB value of the color to determine the final color applied.
The tint value is stored as a double from -1.0 .. 1.0, where -1.0 means 100% darken and 1.0 means 100% lighten. Also, 0.0 means no change.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TExcelColor.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns -1 if obj is more than color, 0 if both colors are the same, and 1 if obj is less than color.

Bottom coordinate for the gradient. This value must be between 0 and 1, and specifies in percent where the last color of the gradient will be placed.
Right coordinate for the gradient. This value must be between 0 and 1, and specifies in percent where the last color of the gradient will be placed.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelMetrics
member.summary: Returns Information to convert between standard units and Excel units.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelMetrics.GetFont0Width(CoherentFlexCel.Core.IRowColSize)
member.summary: Returns the width of the 0 font on Excel. Normally this is 7, but can change depending on the file. The user might modify it by changing Format->Style->Normal.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelMetrics.GetFont0Width(CoherentFlexCel.Core.IRowColSize,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the width of the 0 font on Excel, taking in account the screen dpi, which you set in XlsFile.ScreenScaling. Note that with a scaling more than 100%, the fontsize returned will be proportionally larger. So a font that returns 10 points at 100% will return 20 points at 200%. While it makes no sense (a point is 1/72 of an inch no matter the resolution) this is the way Excel handles it.
member.param: File with the font.

If true, we will return the font size at the given screen scaling. If false, we will return the font size at 100% (96 dpi). Note that if a font is say 7 points at 100%, it will be 14 points at 200%. We need it this way because it is the way Excel uses it.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelMetrics.GetFont0SpaceWidth(CoherentFlexCel.Core.IRowColSize)
member.summary: Returns the width of a space (" ") in the main font of the workbook.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelMetrics.GetRowHeightInPixels(CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFont)
member.summary: Returns the Height of an XF format Excel.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelMetrics.FmlaMult(CoherentFlexCel.Core.IRowColSize)
member.summary: When showing/printing the sheet and "Show formula" check box is on, column widths are double of the normal ones. This method returns 0.5 when "Show formulas" is turned on, and 1 if it is not.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelMetrics.ColMultDisplay(CoherentFlexCel.Core.IRowColSize)
member.summary: Multiply by this number to convert the width of a column from GraphicsUnit.Display units (1/100 inch) to Excel internal units. Note that the default column width is different, you need to multiply by

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelMetrics.RowMultDisplay(CoherentFlexCel.Core.IRowColSize)
member.summary: Multiply by this number to convert the height of a row from GraphicsUnit.Display units (1/100 inch) to Excel internal units.
member.remarks: 1 Height unit=1/20 pt. 1pt=1/72 inch. -> 1 Height unit=1/(72*20) inch. -> 1inch/100= 72*20/100= 14.4 PrintPreview on Excel uses different coordinates than the screen.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelMetrics.ColMult(CoherentFlexCel.Core.IRowColSize)
member.summary: Multiply by this number to convert the width of a column from pixels to excel internal units. Note that the default column width is different, you need to multiply by

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenType
member.summary: Enumerates the different kind of tokens you can find in a formula

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenType.CellAddress
member.summary: A single cell address in the same sheet or to other sheet. See also CellRange for other tokens that can contain addresses.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenType.RelativeCellAddress
member.summary: A cell address relative to the cell where the formula is. This token is used mostly in names.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenType.CellRange
member.summary: A range of cells. See CellAddress for single cell references.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenType.RelativeCellRange
member.summary: A cell range relative to the cell where the formula is. This token is used mostly in names.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenType.FunctionToken
member.summary: A function like "Sum" or "If"

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenType.OperatorToken
member.summary: An operator like "+" or "-"

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenType.RangeOp
member.summary: Operator in ranges, like "Union" or "Intersection"

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenType.Whitespace
member.summary: Whitespace like " "

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenType.Parenthesis
member.summary: A parenthesis surrounding the last token. Note that this token is not used in the formula (since RPN doesn't need parenthesis) but it is there so Excel can display them.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenType.Name
member.summary: A named range

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenType.Data
member.summary: Constant data, like "Hello" and 1 in the formula: "=IF(A1 = 1,,"Hello")"

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenType.DataArray
member.summary: An array of constant data.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenType.MissingArgument
member.summary: A missing argument for a function. For example the second parameter in the formula: "=IF(A1 = 1,,"Hello")"

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenType.ReferenceError
member.summary: A token representing a reference to a cell or range that doesn't exist.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenType.StructuredReference
member.summary: A reference to a Table.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenType.Unsupported
member.summary: This token is not supported by CoherentFlexCel.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenWhitespaceCharacter
member.summary: Character used in the whitespace.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenWhitespaceCharacter.Space
member.summary: Whitespace consists of character 32 (space).

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenWhitespaceCharacter.LineFeed
member.summary: Whitespace consists of character 10 (line feed).

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenWhitespacePosition
member.summary: Specifies where the whitespace is added in relation to the next token.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenWhitespacePosition.BeforeToken
member.summary: This is the normal case. Whitespace is added before the next token. The only case where this option is not used is in the case of parentheses.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenWhitespacePosition.BeforeOpenParenthesis
member.summary: A parenthesis token covers 2 different parentheses: the open and close ones. So for parentheses, we need 2 different cases for whitespace. BeforeOpenParenthesis is for the spaces before the opening parenthesis. You would use it for example in the formula '= ("hello")'

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TTokenWhitespacePosition.BeforeClosingParenthesis
member.summary: A parenthesis token covers 2 different parentheses: the open and close ones. So for parentheses, we need 2 different cases for whitespace. BeforeClosingParenthesis is for the spaces before the closing parenthesis. You would use it for example in the formula '=("hello" )'

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelConfig
member.summary: A central point of for configuring CoherentFlexCel parameters.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelConfig.DpiForImages
member.summary: Allows you to change the dpi for vector images (metafiles) when they are rasterized for converting to pdf / HTML / etc. Note that this is a static setting and will affect all files. This setting is the same as TExcelFile.DpiForImages

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelConfig.DpiForReadingImages
member.summary: Allows you to set a DPI for all images CoherentFlexCel is importing. If this value is 0 (the default), then CoherentFlexCel will try to read the image resolution from the files themselves, if the files have a resolution saved. If there is no resolution saved with the image, CoherentFlexCel will assume the images have the screen resolution. When you set this property to a non 0 value (like 96 for example), then CoherentFlexCel will assume this is the resolution of the images it is reading, ignoring any resolution stored in the file.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelConfig.XlsxCompressionLevel
member.summary: Zip compression level when creating xlsx files. This setting is the same as TExcelFile.XlsxCompressionLevel. Xlsx files are zip files, and you can compress more or less by trading speed for file size. The faster you can create the file, the bigger the xlsx files created will be. Excel by default uses "Fastest" compression level and we use "Default". Normally using compression levels more than default is not worth it, since the files will take a lot longer to be created, and the size reduction will be very small.
member.remarks: Requires .NET 4.5 or newer. In older .NET versions it has no effect and compression is always default.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelConfig.PdfPngCompressionLevel
member.summary: Zip compression level when creating pdf files or re encoding png images. Pds and Png files are zip files, and you can compress more or less by trading speed for file size. The faster you can create the file, the bigger the pdf and png files created will be. Normally using compression levels more than default is not worth it, since the files will take a lot longer to be created, and the size reduction will be very small.
member.remarks: Requires .NET 4.5 or newer. In older .NET versions it has no effect and compression is always default.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelConfig.GraphicFramework
member.summary: Defines the graphics framework that CoherentFlexCel will use. This property currently only works in .NET core or .NET 5 and in Windows.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelConfig.ForcePdfFontsFromDisk
member.summary: If true, CoherentFlexCel will always try to load the fonts for rendering PDF Files from the disk. This allows you to use events like GetFontFolder or GetFontData to tell CoherentFlexCel where the fonts are. If this property is set to false (the default), then CoherentFlexCel will get the font definition directly from the Graphics engine, if the Graphics engine has a primitive to get the font data. SKIA and CoreGraphics are 2 libraries that support getting the fonts directly.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelConfig.MaxFontsToCache
member.summary: Maximum number of fonts that can be cached in memory.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelGraphicFramework
member.summary: Defines the Graphics Framework that CoherentFlexCel will use to render files to images or PDF. Currently only works in .NET Core or .NET 5 and only for Windows.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelGraphicFramework.SkiaSharp
member.summary: CoherentFlexCel will use SKIASharp for its graphics. This has the advantage of having the same results in every platform (Windows, macOS, etc), and the disadvantage of an extra dependency required to SKIA. It also might not support platform-only functionality like Window's EMF files.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelGraphicFramework.Native
member.summary: CoherentFlexCel will use the native graphics engine for the OS. That is GDI+ for Windows, and Skia for the rest.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TImageNaming
member.summary: Defines how images will be automatically named by CoherentFlexCel, when you do not supply a better name.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TImageNaming.Default
member.summary: The image will be named using standard naming, in a format similar to "filename_image_n.png"

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TImageNaming.Guid
member.summary: The image will be named using a GUID. This ensures that any image will be unique even if you have many users requesting the same file at the same time. (Default naming will use the same name for all the users, so images would be overwritten). As a downside, everytime an image is called a new file will be created, so you can get a lot of images just from an user refreshing a page.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.THtmlFixes
member.summary: Defines special fixes to the generated files to workaround browser bugs.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.THtmlFixes.IE6TransparentPngSupport
member.summary: By default, Internet explorer does not support transparent PNGs. Normally this is not an issue, since Excel does not use much transparency. But if you rely on transparent images and don't want to use gif images instead of png, you can set this property to true. It will add special code to the HTML file to support transparent images in IE6.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.THtmlFixes.Outlook2007CssSupport
member.summary: Outlook 2007 renders HTML worse than previous versions, since it switched to the Word 2007 rendering engine instead of Internet Explorer to show HTML emails. If you apply this fix, some code will be added to the generated HTML file to improve the display in Outlook 2007. Other browsers will not be affected and will still render the original file. Turn this option on if you plan to email the generated file as an HTML email or to edit them in Word 2007. Note that the pages will not validate with the w3c validator if this option is on.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.THtmlFixes.WordWrapSupport
member.summary: Some older browsers (and Word 2007) might not support the CSS white-space tag. In this case, if a line longer than a cell cannot be expanded to the right (because there is data in the next cell) it will wrap down instead of being cropped. This fix will cut the text on this cell to the displayable characters. If a letter was displayed by the half on the right, after applying this fix it will not display. This fix is automatically applied when is selected, so there is normally no reason to apply it. You might get a smaller file with this fix (if you have a lot of hidden text), but the display will not be as accurate as when it is off, so it is recommended to keep it off.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelError
member.summary: An enumeration of all possible CoherentFlexCel non fatal errors that can be logged.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelError.Undefined
member.summary: This error should never happen.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelError.XlsTooManyPageBreaks
member.summary: There are more page breaks in this page than the maximum allowed, and page breaks over this maximum are being ignored. You can control if you want a "real" exception here with the and properties.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelError.XlsxInvalidName
member.summary: A corrupt xlsx file can have invalid names. If is set to the correct value, those names will be imported as #REF! instead of rising an Exception.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelError.XlsxMissingPart
member.summary: The file has references to other parts that don't exist. For example, an image might be referenced in a sheet, but the actual image data missing from the file. If is set to the correct value, those parts will be ignored.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelError.RenderMetafile
member.summary: There was a GDI+ error trying to draw or print a metafile. It will be rendered as a bitmap.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelError.RenderCorruptImage
member.summary: The image could not be rendered by GDI+.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelError.RenderErrorDrawingImage
member.summary: An image could not be drawn. This error normally happens in .NET 1.1 if vj# is not installed.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelError.RenderGenericPreview
member.summary: A generic error when drawing the preview.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelError.PdfFontNotFound
member.summary:
The font was not found in the system. A substitute font will be used for the rendering, and it might not look the same.
If you are seeing this message in a server, make sure the server has the same fonts installed as the machine where you developed the application.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelError.PdfGlyphNotInFont
member.summary:
CoherentFlexCel is trying to render a character that is not in the font or the fallback fonts. This character will show as an empty square in the generated PDF file.
Normally this means that Excel is replacing fonts, for example Arial with MS Mincho, and to fix this error you should provide a suitable list of Fallback fonts. Look at for more information.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelError.PdfUsedFallbackFont
member.summary:
CoherentFlexCel is trying to render a character that is not in the font, but it is in the fallback font list. This character will be drawn with the fallback font.
Normally this means that Excel is replacing fonts, for example Arial with MS Mincho. Look at for more information.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelError.PdfFauxBoldOrItalics
member.summary:
The font you are trying to use does not have a "bold" or "italic" variation, and we will use "faux" font created by making the normal font heavier or slanting it to the right. This normally results in lower quality text that might not look good. We recommend that you use fonts that have italics and bold variations.
If you want to avoid CoherentFlexCel creating faux bold or italic, you can set CoherentFlexCelPdfExport.UseFauxStyles = false. But even if you set that property off, this warning will still appear in CoherentFlexCelTrace.
Look at for more information.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelError.PdfCorruptFontInFontFolder
member.summary: The "Fonts" folder in this machine has a file that could not be parsed by CoherentFlexCel and is probably corrupt. While this will not affect CoherentFlexCel in any way, you might want to look at the "Font" folder and remove this font, since it can make windows slower.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelError.PdfFontLicenseDoesntAllowEmbedding
member.summary: Trying to embed a font which is not licensed to be embedded.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelError.HtmlSaveSharingViolation
member.summary: There was a sharing violation when trying to save an html file, and is true. Normally this just means two parallel threads trying to write the same file and can be safely ignored.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.CoherentFlexCelError.MalformedUrl
member.summary: A malformed Url was detected in the xls file and was not exported. An example of this might be: "mailto:test@test@test".

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFontScheme
member.summary: Specifies the scheme to which a font belongs in the theme. This attribute is only valid in Excel 2007 or newer.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFontScheme.None
member.summary: Font is not a theme font and is not linked to the theme. When you change the theme of the spreadsheet, "None" fonts will remain unchanged.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFontScheme.Minor
member.summary: The font is a minor font for the scheme. This is the font that shows (Body) at the right of the font selector box in Excel. Whenever you change the theme of the spreadsheet, all minor fonts in all cells will change to reflect the new minor font in the theme.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFontScheme.Major
member.summary: The font is a major font for the scheme. This is the font that shows (Headings) at the right of the font selector box in Excel. Whenever you change the theme of the spreadsheet, all major fonts in all cells will change to reflect the new major font in the theme.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFont
member.summary: Encapsulation of an Excel Font.

member.summary: Creates a font with size 10 and name "Arial".

member.summary: Creates a font with size and name.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFont.Name
member.summary: Font name. (For example, "Arial"). Important: When using Excel 2007, if is different from "None", the font scheme takes precedence over the name. If for example Name = "Arial" but Scheme is Major and the major font is Calibri, the font will use Calibri.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFont.Size20
member.summary: Height of the font (in units of 1/20th of a point). A Size20 = 200 means 10 points.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFont.Color
member.summary: Color of the font.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFont.Style
member.summary: Style of the font, such as bold or italics. Underline is a different option.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFont.Underline
member.summary: Underline type.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFont.Family
member.summary: Font family, (see Windows API LOGFONT structure).

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFont.CharSet
member.summary: Character set. (see Windows API LOGFONT structure)

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFont.Scheme
member.summary:
Font scheme. This only applies to Excel 2007. Note that this property takes over other properties like font name: If the scheme is for example "Major" and the theme has a Major font defined as calibri, then the font will be Calibri no matter if you change the font name.
To manually change the font name, make sure to set Scheme = TFontScheme.None
