member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat
member.summary: Format for one cell or named style. Cell formats are used to format cells, Named styles to create styles. A Cell format can have a parent style format, even when normally this is null (parent is normal format). Named styles will have a non-null Style property. Cell formats will have style = null.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an empty Format class. Don't use this to get TFlxFormat instances, use XlsFile.GetDefaultFormat instead.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.CreateStandard2007
member.summary: Returns a standard TFlxFormat for Excel 2007. (Font name is Calibri, etc). You will normally want to use instead of this, since it returns the default format for an specific file, and not a generic format like this.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.Font
member.summary: Cell Font.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.Borders
member.summary: Cell borders.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.Format
member.summary:
Format string. (For example, "yyyy-mm-dd" for a date format, or "#.00" for a numeric 2 decimal format)
This format string is the same you use in Excel under "Custom" format when formatting a cell (for English versions of Excel), and it is documented in the Excel documentation. You can use APIMate to find out which string to use from a format you entered in Excel.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.FillPattern
member.summary: Fill pattern.

member.summary: Horizontal alignment on the cell.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.VAlignment
member.summary: Vertical alignment on the cell.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.Locked
member.summary: Cell is locked.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.Hidden
member.summary: Cell is Hidden.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.WrapText
member.summary: Cell wrap.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.ShrinkToFit
member.summary: Shrink to fit.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.Rotation
member.summary:
Text Rotation in degrees.
When this value is from 0 to 90 then this is the rotation degrees in the up direction.
When this value is from 91 to 180 then this is a rotation in the down direction. 91 means -1 degree rotation, 92 means -2 degrees, and so on until 180 which means -90 degrees.
255 is vertical text.
Other values are invalid.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.Indent
member.summary: Indent value. (in characters). This value can't be bigger than 15 in Excel 2003 or earlier, and no bigger than 250 in Excel 2007 or newer.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.IsStyle
member.summary: When true this format is a named style, when false a cell format.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.Lotus123Prefix
member.summary: If true the prefix for the cell is compatible with Lotus 123.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.ReadingOrder
member.summary: Reading order for the cell.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.ParentStyle
member.summary: Name of the Parent style. Normally you will want to keep it at null (parent is normal style), but you can write an existing style here. If is true this property is not used.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.NotNullParentStyle
member.summary: This is similar to but will return "Normal" when the parent is null.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.LinkedStyle
member.summary: If this object holds a Cell format, LinkedStyle specifies which properties of the cell format are linked to its parent style. If this object holds a Style format, LinkedStyle specifies the default set of properties that will be applied when you use this style from Excel.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat.Clone

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxApplyFormat.Format
member.summary:
Format string. (For example, "yyyy-mm-dd" for a date format, or "#.00" for a numeric 2 decimal format)
This format string is the same you use in Excel under "Custom" format when formatting a cell, and it is documented in Excel documentation. Under "Finding out what format string to use in TFlxFormat.Format" section in UsingCoherentFlexCelAPI.pdf you can find more detailed information on how to create this string.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxApplyFormat.Rotation
member.summary:
Text Rotation in degrees.
When this value is from 0 to 90 then this is the rotation degrees in the up direction.
When this value is from 91 to 180 then this is a rotation in the down direction. 91 means -1 degree rotation, 92 means -2 degrees, and so on until 180 which means -90 degrees.
255 is vertical text.
Other values are invalid.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle
member.summary: This class is used as a part of a class, and stores how a cell format is linked to a style.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle.AutomaticChoose
member.summary: When this property is true (the default) CoherentFlexCel will automatically choose which linked properties to apply depending on what changes from the base style. For example, if this style has a different font than the basic style, the font will be not linked, and when you change the base style it will keep the same. Excel behaves this way when it adds styles. To manually choose what the format will affect, set this to none. This property doesn't correspond with any Excel property, and it is not stored in the file.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle.LinkedNumericFormat
member.summary: If true, the numeric format will be linked to the parent style, and it will change when you change the style. If false the numeric format will not change even if you change it in the base style. Note that this property has no effect unless is false.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle.LinkedFont
member.summary: If true, the font will be linked to the parent style, and it will change when you change the style. If false the font will not change even if you change it in the base style. Note that this property has no effect unless is false.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle.LinkedAlignment
member.summary: If true, the alignment will be linked to the parent style, and it will change when you change the style. If false the alignment not change even if you change it in the base style. Note that this property has no effect unless is false.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle.LinkedBorder
member.summary: If true, the border will be linked to the parent style, and it will change when you change the style. If false the border will not change even if you change it in the base style. Note that this property has no effect unless is false.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle.LinkedFill
member.summary: If true, the fill pattern will be linked to the parent style, and it will change when you change the style. If false the fill pattern will not change even if you change it in the base style. Note that this property has no effect unless is false.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle.LinkedProtection
member.summary: If true, the protection will be linked to the parent style, and it will change when you change the style. If false the protection will not change even if you change it in the base style. Note that this property has no effect unless is false.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle.Assign(CoherentFlexCel.Core.TLinkedStyle)
member.summary: Copies a new style into this object.
member.param: Style with the values to copy.

member.summary: Returns true if the 2 instances have the same data.
member.param: Style with which we want to compare.
member.returns: True if otherStyle has the same values as this object.

member.summary: Returns a deep copy of the object.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxMessage.TxtDefaultTimeAMString
member.summary: Default text to show when AM time string is set to empty on the regional settings dialog from the control panel. When the default is empty, Excel defaults to AM, while .NET defaults to an empty string. As we want to behave the same as Excel, we provide this constant here.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxMessage.TxtDefaultTimePMString
member.summary: Default text to show when PM time string is set to empty on the regional settings dialog from the control panel. When the default is empty, Excel defaults to PM, while .NET defaults to an empty string. As we want to behave the same as Excel, we provide this constant here.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.FlxMessages
member.summary:
CoherentFlexCel Native string Constants. It reads the resources from the active locale, and returns the correct string. If your language is not supported and you feel like translating the messages, please send us a copy. We will include it on the next CoherentFlexCel version.
To add a new language:
Copy the file flxmsg.resx to your language (for example, flxmsg.es.resx to translate to Spanish)
Edit the new file and change the messages.
Add the .resx file to the CoherentFlexCel project

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TAdaptativeFormats
member.summary: Information about characters in a numeric format that need to be adapted when rendering. For example, if the cell A1 has value 1 and format "*_0" it will print as "______1" when the cell is wide, and as "_1" when the cell is shorter.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TAdaptativeFormats.WildcardPos
member.summary: Position of the last wildcard ("*") character in the format (0 based). If a wildcard is present in the format, the string has to be expanded with the character at position until it fits the width of the cell. A negative value means there is no wildcard in the format.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TAdaptativeFormats.Separators
member.summary: An array of positions and characters that must be used to pad the string. In this field you have the the "_" and "?" numeric format delimeters from Excel. The spaces at the positions in the position array should have the width of the character specified in this field. If null, there are no separators in this class.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TAdaptativeFormats.IsEmpty
member.summary: Returns true if this class has no adaptative formats.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TAdaptativeFormats.ApplySeparators(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the string with the characters at the positions in Separator changed by the characters specified in Separators.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TAdaptativeFormats.AddSeparator(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a separator at a given position. Separator array will be kept in order when you add a value. This routine considers utf32 characters.
member.param: String with the characters.
Position in the format string. (0 based)
Position in the final string. (0 based)

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TAdaptativeFormats.AddSeparator(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a char separator at a given position. Separator array will be kept in order when you add a value.
member.param: Character that will be used to calculate the width of the string.
Position in the final string. (0 based)

member.summary: This assumes separators in New are all sorted and after separators in old.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxNumberFormat.FormatValue(System.Object,System.String,CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelFile)
member.summary: Formats a value as it would be shown by Excel.
member.param: Value to format.

Cell Format. (For example, "yyyy-mm-dd" for a date format, or "#.00" for a numeric 2 decimal format)
This format string is the same you use in Excel under "Custom" format when formatting a cell (for English versions of Excel), and it is documented in the Excel documentation. You can use APIMate to find out which string to use from a format you entered in Excel.
Workbook with the cell. If null, no color information will be returned and the base date fill be assumed to be 1900 (windows) and not 1904 (macs).

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxNumberFormat.FormatValue(System.Object,System.String,CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIColor@,CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelFile,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Formats a value as it would be shown by Excel.
member.param: Value to format.

Cell Format. (For example, "yyyy-mm-dd" for a date format, or "#.00" for a numeric 2 decimal format)
This format string is the same you use in Excel under "Custom" format when formatting a cell (for English versions of Excel), and it is documented in the Excel documentation. You can use APIMate to find out which string to use from a format you entered in Excel.
Final color of the text. (Depending on the format, color might change. I.e. Red for negatives)
Workbook with the cell. If null, no color information will be returned and the base date fill be assumed to be 1900 (windows) and not 1904 (macs).
Returns if the format contains a date.
Returns if the format contains a time.
member.returns: Formatted string.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TStructRefSection
member.summary: This enum contains the possible values that can go into a structured reference. You can combine multiple values, but not all combinations make sense. For example #Data + #Headers it fine, but #All + #Headers is just #All.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TStructRefSection.None
member.summary: Nothing.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TStructRefSection.All
member.summary: The structured reference applies to the whole table. This is equivalent to [#All].

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TStructRefSection.Headers
member.summary: The structured reference applies to the headers of the table. This is equivalent to [#Headers].

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TStructRefSection.Data
member.summary: The structured reference applies to data (all the table without headers or totals) of the table. This is equivalent to [#Data].

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TStructRefSection.Totals
member.summary: The structured reference applies to the totals row of the table. This is equivalent to [#Totals].

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TStructRefSection.ThisRow
member.summary: The structured reference applies to the row of the table where the reference is. This is equivalent to @ or [#This row].

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIFont.CreateFromMemory(System.Byte[],System.Double,CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIFontStyle,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Creates a font from the font data. IMPORTANT NOTE: When using GDI+ (default in Windows), this method will create a FontCollection that can never be disposed until the application exits.
When using GDI+, try not to use this method, or make sure that it is called only a couple of times since the memory for the loaded font won't be released. On the other hand, calling this method multiple times with the same font is ok, CoherentFlexCel will cache the font and not create multiple instances.
member.param: Byte array containing the ttf font data.
Size in points of the font.
Style of the font (italic, bold, etc)
Index of the font

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIFont.CreateFromFile(System.String,System.Double,CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIFontStyle,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Creates a font from a font file. IMPORTANT NOTE: When using GDI+ (default in Windows), this method will create a FontCollection that can never be disposed until the application exits.
When using GDI+, try not to use this method, or make sure that it is called only a couple of times since the memory for the loaded font won't be released. On the other hand, calling this method multiple times with the same font is ok, CoherentFlexCel will cache the font and not create multiple instances.
member.param: Filename of the file containing the ttf font data.
Size in points of the font.
Style of the font (italic, bold, etc)
Index of the font

member.summary: Override this method to dispose your own objects in your descending classes.
member.param: If true, this is a direct call to Dispose(), and you need to dispose both managed and unmanaged resources. If false, this is called by the finalizer, and you only need to release unmanaged resources.

member.name: E:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIFont.FontCreating
member.summary: Fires before a font is created. You can customize the font properties and create a different font instead. Note that this event is static and it applies to the whole app.

member.name: E:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIFont.FontCreated
member.summary:
Fires after a font has been created. You can use this event to handle fonts that don't exist in your system and are replaced by a different font by the OS. Note that this event is static and it applies to the whole app.
Remark: As this event fires after the font has been created, it means that if you modify it the font is created twice. It is not going to have a big impact in performance, but if possible use the event instead, as it won't cause the font to be created twice. This event has to be used only for cases where you want to override the default operating system font substitution algorithm.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIDashStyle
member.summary: Platform independent line style.

member.summary: Specifies a solid line.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIDashStyle.Dot
member.summary: Specifies a line consisting of dots.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIDashStyle.SmallDash
member.summary: Specifies a line consisting of small dashes, smaller than dashes but longer than dots.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIDashStyle.Dash
member.summary: Specifies a line consisting of dashes.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIDashStyle.DashDot
member.summary: Specifies a line consisting of a repeating pattern of dash-dot.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIDashStyle.LongDash
member.summary: Specifies a line consisting of big dashes.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIDashStyle.LongDashDot
member.summary: Specifies a line consisting of a repeating pattern of large dashes and dots.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIDashStyle.LongDashDotDot
member.summary: Specifies a line consisting of a repeating pattern of large dash-dot-dot.

member.summary: Disposes this instance.

member.summary: Override this method to dispose your own objects in your descending classes.
member.param: If true, this is a direct call to Dispose(), and you need to dispose both managed and unmanaged resources. If false, this is called by the finalizer, and you only need to release unmanaged resources.

member.summary: A pattern of horizontal lines.

member.summary: A pattern of vertical lines.

member.summary: A pattern of lines on a diagonal from upper left to lower right.

member.summary: A pattern of lines on a diagonal from upper right to lower left.

member.summary: Specifies a 5-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 5:95.

member.summary: Specifies a 10-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 10:90.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIHatchStyle.Percent20
member.summary: Specifies a 20-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 20:80.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIHatchStyle.Percent25
member.summary: Specifies a 25-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 25:75.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIHatchStyle.Percent30
member.summary: Specifies a 30-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 30:70.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIHatchStyle.Percent40
member.summary: Specifies a 40-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 40:60.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIHatchStyle.Percent50
member.summary: Specifies a 50-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 50:50.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIHatchStyle.Percent60
member.summary: Specifies a 60-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 60:40.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIHatchStyle.Percent70
member.summary: Specifies a 70-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 70:30.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIHatchStyle.Percent75
member.summary: Specifies a 75-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 75:25.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIHatchStyle.Percent80
member.summary: Specifies a 80-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 80:100.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TUIHatchStyle.Percent90
member.summary: Specifies a 90-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 90:10.

member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of confetti.

member.summary: Specifies horizontal lines that are composed of zigzags.

member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of divots.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TMultipartType
member.summary: Different ways to define a multipart archive.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TMultipartType.Related
member.summary: Parts inside this container are related, for example this message could contain an HTML file and its external images.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TMultipartType.Alternative
member.summary: Parts inside this container are an alternative one from the other. For example, a message could be sent in HTML and plain Text, once inside a different MIME part, and the mail reader should chose the best alternative of the parts to display.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TMultipartType.Mixed
member.summary: Parts inside this MIME container are not related, e.g. different attachments.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TMultipartType.Digest
member.summary: A compilation of messages, used in forwarded emails.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TMultipartType.Signed
member.summary: A part containing files and one signature.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TContentTransferEncoding
member.summary: Defines how a part of a MIME message will be coded.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TContentTransferEncoding.QuotedPrintable
member.summary: Use the Quoted Printable algorithm (RFC 2045 section 6.7). You will normally use this encoding for text. When using this option, you need to write the part content using or a similar method.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TContentTransferEncoding.Base64
member.summary: Use base64 algorithm (RFC 2045 section 6.7). You would normally use this encoding for binary files. When using this option, you need to write the part content using or a similar method.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TQEncodeMetaInfo
member.summary: Defines how a string returned by Q-Encode will be handled.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TQEncodeMetaInfo.None
member.summary: This will return the raw Q-Encoded string, without "=?charset?encoding?" at the beginning or "?=" at the end.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TQEncodeMetaInfo.Always
member.summary: This will always return the Q-Encoded string with "=?charset?encoding?" at the beginning and "?=" at the end.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TQEncodeMetaInfo.OnlyIfNeeded
member.summary: This will return the string with "=?charset?encoding?" only if the original string has special characters that need encoding, if not it will return the original string without encoding.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TMimeWriter
member.summary: A simple class used to create MIME formatted messages. While it does not provide much functionality, it gives enough to create simple multipart archives.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TMimeWriter.CreateMultiPartMessage(System.IO.TextWriter,CoherentFlexCel.Core.TMultipartType,System.String,System.Uri)
member.summary: Creates the headers for a multipart MIME file. This must be the first method to call in order to create a MIME file. After this, you need to call and start adding the parts of the message, and you always need to end the message by calling .
member.param: Type of multipart for this file.
Type of the header as defined in the MIME standard, e.g. "text/plain", "text/html", etc. This is the type of the main part on a related message. Set it to null if there is no main part.
The location for the whole mime file. null if you do not want to set a location. for this to work in ie/opera, etc, this should be something like "file:///filename.ext"

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TMimeWriter.AddPartHeader(System.IO.TextWriter,System.String,CoherentFlexCel.Core.TContentTransferEncoding,System.Uri,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the header for a part in a multipart Mime message. After calling this method, you need to write your data content into the TextWriter using or and after that always call .
member.param: TextWriter where you are saving the message.
Type of the header as defined in the MIME standard, e.g. "text/plain", "text/html", etc.
How the part will be codified. Use base64 for binary TextWriter and quotedprintable for text.
The location for this resource. null if you do not want to set a location.

Content id of the resource, if you want to use it in cid: links. Null if you do not want to specify a content-id. Note that this string will not be escaped by the framework, so make sure it contains valid characters. As it needs to be globally unique, normally a GUID can be a good option here.
Name for the encoding on this part. Null means do not write an encoding. (for example in binary parts)

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TMimeWriter.EndPart(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Ends a MIME part started with .
member.param: TextWriter where you are saving the message.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TMimeWriter.EndMultiPartMessage(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Call this method after the last call to EndPart, to finish the MIME message.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TMimeWriter.QEncode(System.String,CoherentFlexCel.Core.TQEncodeMetaInfo)
member.summary: Returns the Q-encode of a string, used in the MIME Headers. //RFC 2047
member.param: String to encode
Defines if to add the string "=?charset?encoding?" will be appended at the begining, and "?=" at the end.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TMimeWriter.WriteQuotedPrintable(System.IO.TextWriter,System.String)
member.summary: Writes the Quoted Printable encoding of a string, as defined in RFC 2045 section 6.7 This method keeps state and breaks the line every time it is longer than 76 characters. The state is reset each time is called.
member.param: TextWriter where we will write the data.
String to Encode.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TMimeWriter.WriteBase64(System.IO.TextWriter,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Writes the base64 encoding of a byte array, as defined in RFC 2045 section 6.8 This method does not keep the state, so all binary data must be supplied at once. As an alternative you could use System.Convert.ToBase64String(byte[], int, int), but this method avoids creating a temporary string, and then doubling the memory needed for the encoding. This method will also correctly split the string at 76 characters, while Convert.ToBase64 in .NET 1.1 will not. (2.0 added this support)
member.param: TextWriter where we will write the data.
String to Encode.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TClientAnchor.Dy2
member.summary: Delta y of image on 1/255 of a cell. 0 means totally at the top, 128 on half of the cell, 255 means at the top of next cell.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TClientAnchor.ChildAnchor
member.summary: Returns the offset on the parent system for the image, when it is grouped. For example, if the parent shape on the group is 100 px wide, and ChildAnchor has a dx of 0.5, the image starts 50px to the right of the parent. If the shape is not grouped or it is the shape on top of the group, ChildAnchor is null. When this member is not null, other values on ClientAnchor have no meaning.
member.remarks: This offset is relative to the parent shape. If there are 2 parent shapes before on the hierarchy, this object applies to the parent, not the grandparent.

member.summary: This method will create an anchor so the image keeps its aspect ratio, and it is contained inside the group of cells. If you supply negative values for Col2 or Row2, then those values will be ignored. If you set Col2 negative, then this method will place the image between Row1 and Row2, and calculate Col2 so the image keeps its aspect ratio. Similar if you set Row2 negative.
member.param: Image that you want to insert. It is used to know its dimensions and dpi.
How the image behaves when copying/inserting cells.
First Row of object.

Last row of object.Set it to 0 or negative for unlimited rows.
Delta y of image on 1/255 of a cell. 0 means totally at the top, 128 on half of the cell, 255 means at the top of next cell.
Last column of object.Set it to 0 or negative for unlimited columns.
Delta x of image, on 1/1024 of a cell. 0 means totally at the left, 512 on half of the cell, 1024 means at the left of next cell.
How the image will be fit inside the range of cells.
How the image will be fit inside the range of cells.
ExcelFile with the workbook, used to calculate the cells.

member.param: Name of the range.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Named range with the given values. Use this overload to create a simple range.
member.param: Name of the range.
Sheet index for the sheet that holds the range. 0 means a global range (default on Excel)
Sheet index where the range apply. This is where row and col properties apply, not where the range is stored. (1-based)
First row on range.
First column on range.
Last row on range.
Last column on range.
Options of this Range.

The formula for the range, expressed as text. Use it if the range is complex and cannot be expressed with aSheetIndex, aFirstRow... etc When you specify this parameter, all SheetIndex, aFirstRow, etc. lose their meaning.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Named range with the given values. This is the most complete overload, you normally don't need to call it.
member.param: Name of the range.
Sheet index for the sheet that holds the range. 0 means a global range (default on Excel)
Sheet index where the range apply. This is where row and col properties apply, not where the range is stored. (1-based)
First row on range.
First column on range.
Last row on range.
Last column on range.
Options of this Range.

The formula for the range, expressed as text. Use it if the range is complex and cannot be expressed with aSheetIndex, aFirstRow... etc When you specify this parameter, all SheetIndex, aFirstRow, etc. lose their meaning.
Note that with relative references, we always consider "A1" to be the cell where the name is. This means that the formula: "=$A$1 + A1" when evaluated in Cell B8, will read "=$A$1 + B8". To provide a negative offset, you need to wrap the formula. For example "=A1048575" will evaluate to B7 when evaluated in B8.
Comment for the named range. Note that this will only show in Excel 2007 or newer.

member.param: Name of the range.
Sheet index for the sheet that holds the range. 0 means a global range (default on Excel)
Sheet index where the range apply. This is where row and col properties apply, not where the range is stored. (1-based)
First row on range.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a complex Named range, with a formula.
member.param: Name of the range.
Sheet index for the sheet that holds the range. 0 means a global range (default on Excel)
Options of this Range.

The formula for the range, expressed as text. For example: "A1:B2,C3:C7"
Note that with relative references, we always consider "A1" to be the cell where the name is. This means that the formula: "=$A$1 + A1" when evaluated in Cell B8, will read "=$A$1 + B8". To provide a negative offset, you need to wrap the formula. For example "=A1048575" will evaluate to B7 when evaluated in B8.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.NameSheetIndex

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.OptionFlags
member.summary:
Options of the range. You can access the options by using the corresponding properties. (Hidden, BuiltIn, etc).
You can use this property to set them all at the same time.
You can get the properties by OR'ing the following values:
01. Name is hidden. Corresponds to the property .
02. Name is a function. Corresponds to the property .
04. Name is a VB procedure. If set you also need to set 08 (name is a macro). Corresponds to the property .
08. Name is a Macro. Corresponds to the property .
16. Name returns an Array. Corresponds to the property .
32. Name is a BuiltIn name (like Print_Area). Corresponds to the property .
8192. Name will be published when exporting to html. Corresponds to the property .
16384. Indicates that the name is used as a workbook parameter on a version of the workbook that is published to or rendered on a Web or application server. Corresponds to the property .

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TXlsNamedRange.RangeFormula
member.summary:
This is a formula defining the range. It can be used to define complex ranges. For example you can use "=Sheet1!$A:$B,Sheet1!$1:$2". When this parameter is set, SheetIndex, Left, Top, Right and Bottom properties have no meaning.
Note that with relative references, we always consider "A1" to be the cell where the name is. This means that the formula: "=$A$1 + A1" when evaluated in Cell B8, will read "=$A$1 + B8". To provide a negative offset, you need to wrap the formula. For example "=A1048575" will evaluate to B7 when evaluated in B8.
member.remarks:
In latest CoherentFlexCel versions, you *can* use ranges like "A:B" instead (A1:B65536). Using "A:B" form is preferred, since it will work also in Excel 2007.
If this formula refers to a cell range, you can get the cell range by calling .
To get the text for a particular cell, use .
To get the result of evaluating the formula, use

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TCellAddress.DecodeColumn(System.String)
member.summary: Returns 1 for column "A", 2 for "B" and so on. If the string isn't a valid column name, this method will return -1. You normally will just want to create TCellAddress to convert between cell references (var cell = new TCellAddress(row, col); DoSomething(cell.CellRef). But this method could be used in specific cases where you want only the column string and not the full address.
member.param: String which defines a column.
member.returns: -1 if col can't be converted to a column reference, or the column number (1 based) otherwise.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TCellAddress.TryParseSheet(System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Parses a string like Sheet1!A1 into a sheet component and the rest. If the sheet is quoted ('sheet 1') it will be unquoted.
member.param: String to parse
Part of the string that is the sheet.
Part of the string that is not the sheet.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TCellAddress.TrySetCellRef(System.String,CoherentFlexCel.Core.TReferenceStyle,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Tries to set a cell reference, and returns true if the cell is a correct A1 or R1C1 reference.
member.param: String with the cell reference, in A1 or R1C1 format.
Style the reference is in (A1 or R1C1).

Row where the cell is. This is only used for R1C1 relative references, to know where the cell is. For example, the reference R[1]C[1] when cellRow is 5 will reference row 6. A1 references or absolute R1C1 references ignore this parameter.

Column where the cell is. This is only used for R1C1 relative references, to know where the cell is. For example, the reference R[1]C[1] when cellCol is 5 will reference column 6. A1 references or absolute R1C1 references ignore this parameter.
member.returns: True if value was a correct cell reference, false otherwise.

member.summary: Creates a new TFormulaSpan and sets its values.
member.param: How many rows the formula will use.
How many columns the formula will use.

Indicates if this is the first formula of the array. Only the formula that is at the top left cell of the group will be used when setting a formula. Other formulas will be ignored, so you can copy formulas in a loop from one place to the other without worring if the cell is at the top left or not.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFormula
member.summary: An Excel formula. Use this class to pass a formula to an Excel sheet.
member.remarks: There are 4 public members here: 1) The formula text 2) The internal formula data. This member is not public. 3) The formula result. If RecalcMode is not manual, this value will be ignored. 4) The formula span. Some formulas, like some array formulas, can span over more than one cell. Not all of them need to be set, in fact, you won't probably never set internal formula data. Internal formula data is used so we can make CoherentFlexCel1.SetValue(CoherentFlexCel2.GetValue(1,1)); and not have to convert data->text->back to data.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRichString
member.summary:
A string cell value with its rich text information. RTFRuns is an array of TRTFRun structures, where each struct identifies a font style for a portion of text. For example, if you have: Value = "Hello" RTFRuns = {FirstChar:1 FontIndex:1, FirstChar:3, FontIndex:2}
"H" (char 0) will be formatted with the specific cell format.
"el" (chars 1 and 2) will have font number 1
"lo" (chars 3 and 4) will have font number 2

member.summary: List with fonts. We will copy them here to make it independent of the current Workbook. Having a reference to the workbook could lead to a memory leak, if we null the workbook but not the RichString.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRichString.FromHtml(System.String,CoherentFlexCel.Core.TFlxFormat,CoherentFlexCel.Core.ExcelFile)
member.summary: Returns a new TRichString from an HTML text. Note that only some tags from HTML are converted, the ones that do not have correspondence on Excel rich text will be discarded.Note: This method is for advanced uses only. Normally you would just use
member.param: Html string we want to convert.

Original format of the cell where we want to enter the string. Note that depending on the starting cell, the Rich string will be different. For example, if you have a cell with Red text and add a "hello <b> world" string, then resulting RichString will include a RED bold "world" string
File where this string will be added.
member.returns: A TRichString containing the converted Html.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRichString.op_Addition(CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRichString,CoherentFlexCel.Core.TRichString)
member.summary: Concatenates two TRichString objects. Be careful that formats will be preserved from s1 to s2. If s1 ends up in red, s2 will start with red too. If you want to avoid this, make sure s2 has a font definition at character 0. ALSO, MAKE SURE YOU ARE CONCATENATING RICH STRINGS FROM THE SAME WORKBOOK, SO FONT INDEXES ARE SIMILAR.
member.param: First string to concatenate.
Second string to concatenate.

Second TRTFRun instance to compare.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TEncryptionType
member.summary: How the file is encrypted. This applies only to xls files. Xlsx files are encrypted using the Agile xlsx encryption.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TEncryptionType.Xor
member.summary: Excel 95 XOR encryption.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TEncryptionType.Standard
member.summary: Excel 97/2000 encryption.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TEncryptionType.Strong
member.summary: Excel XP/2003 encryption. Note that despite the name, this mode has multiple known vulnerabilities and it is just marginally better than TEncryptionType.Standard. Both use RC4 algorithm to encrypt, which is weak. If you need files to be really secure, you need to use xlsx (which supports AES), not xls.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TEncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: Encryption algorithms supported in xlsx encrypted files.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TEncryptionAlgorithm.AES_128
member.summary: AES 128. This is the default in Excel 2007/2010

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TEncryptionAlgorithm.AES_192
member.summary: AES 192

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TEncryptionAlgorithm.AES_256
member.summary: AES 256

member.summary: Password used to protect the range. Use empty or null to have no password. Note: As this password is not saved in the file, when you open a file this property will be empty. You can know if a file has a password by looking at . Setting this property will set the property using the current .

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TProtectedRange.PasswordHash
member.summary: This is the hash for the password that is stored in the file. You shouldn't set this property directly unless you are copying the hash from other place. When you set this property, will be reset.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TProtectedRange.EncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: Returns the encryption algorithm used to encrypt the password hash.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TProtectedRange.Ranges
member.summary: Ranges of cells this protection applies to. You can specify more than one range of cells for the same ProtectedRange.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TProtectedRange.Name
member.summary: Name of the protected range.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TProtectedRange.SecurityDescriptorXLSX
member.summary: Returns the security descriptor of the protected range, for XLSX files. This is a string used if you are giving permissions to some users in the range. Note that because of the different security descriptor formats, CoherentFlexCel won't convert between security descriptors from xls and xlsx. Take a look at APIMate to see the descriptor of a particular file.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TProtectedRange.SecurityDescriptorXLS
member.summary: Returns the security descriptor of the protected range, for XLS files. This is a byte array encapsulating a Windows Security Descriptor, and it is used if you are giving permissions to some users in the range. Note that because of the different security descriptor formats, CoherentFlexCel won't convert between security descriptors from xls and xlsx. Take a look at APIMate to see the descriptor of a particular file.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapePresetGuideType
member.summary: Internal use.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapePresetGuideType.Pr_cd
member.summary: m/n of a Circle ('mcdn') - The units here are in 60,000ths of a degree.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapePresetGuideType.Pr_b
member.summary: Shape Bottom Edge ('b') - Constant value of "h" This is the bottom edge of the shape and since the top edge of the shape is considered the 0 point, the bottom edge is thus the shape height.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapePresetGuideType.Pr_h
member.summary: Shape Height ('h') This is the variable height of the shape defined in the shape properties. This value is received from the shape transform listed within the spPr element.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapePresetGuideType.Pr_hc
member.summary: Horizontal Center ('hc') - Calculated value of "*/ w 1.0 2.0" This is the horizontal center of the shape which is just the width divided by 2.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapePresetGuideType.Pr_hd
member.summary: 1/n of Shape Height ('hdn') - Calculated value of "*/ h 1.0 n.0" This is 1/n the shape height.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapePresetGuideType.Pr_l
member.summary: Shape Left Edge ('l') - Constant value of "0" This is the left edge of the shape and the left edge of the shape is considered the horizontal 0 point.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapePresetGuideType.Pr_ls
member.summary: Longest Side of Shape ('ls') - Calculated value of "max w h" This is the longest side of the shape. This value is either the width or the height depending on which is greater.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapePresetGuideType.Pr_r
member.summary: Shape Right Edge ('r') - Constant value of "w" This is the right edge of the shape and since the left edge of the shape is considered the 0 point, the right edge is thus the shape width.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapePresetGuideType.Pr_ss
member.summary: Shortest Side of Shape ('ss') - Calculated value of "min w h" This is the shortest side of the shape. This value is either the width or the height depending on which is smaller.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapePresetGuideType.Pr_ssd
member.summary: 1/n Shortest Side of Shape ('ssdn') - Calculated value of "*/ ss 1.0 n.0"

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapePresetGuideType.Pr_t
member.summary: Shape Top Edge ('t') - Constant value of "0" This is the top edge of the shape and the top edge of the shape is considered the vertical 0 point.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapePresetGuideType.Pr_vc
member.summary: Vertical Center of Shape ('vc') - Calculated value of "*/ h 1.0 2.0" This is the vertical center of the shape which is just the height divided by 2.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapePresetGuideType.Pr_w
member.summary: Shape Width ('w') This is the variable width of the shape defined in the shape properties. This value is received from the shape transform listed within the spPr element.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TShapePresetGuideType.Pr_wd
member.summary: 1/n of Shape Width ('wdn') - Calculated value of "*/ w 1.0 n.0" This is 1/n the shape width.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TThemeTextFont.CharSet
member.summary: Specifies the character set which is supported by the parent font. member.summary: Specifies that the fill should rotate with the shape.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TGradientFill.TileRect
member.summary: This element specifies a rectangular region of the shape to which the gradient is applied. This region is then tiled across the remaining area of the shape to complete the fill. The tile rectangle is defined by percentage offsets from the sides of the shape's bounding box.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TGradientFill.Flip
member.summary:
Specifies the direction(s) in which to flip the gradient while tiling.
Normally a gradient fill encompasses the entire bounding box of the shape which contains the fill. However, with the tileRect element, it is possible to define a "tile" rectangle which is smaller than the bounding box. In this situation, the gradient fill is encompassed within the tile rectangle, and the tile rectangle is tiled across the bounding box to fill the entire area

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TGradientFill.GradientStops
member.summary: The list of gradient stops that specifies the gradient colors and their relative positions in the color band.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingLinearGradient.Angle
member.summary: Specifies the direction of color change for the gradient. To define this angle, let its value be x measured clockwise. Then ( -sin x, cos x ) is a vector parallel to the line of constant color in the gradient fill.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingLinearGradient.Scaled
member.summary: Whether the gradient angle scales with the fill region. Mathematically, if this flag is true, then the gradient vector ( cos x , sin x ) is scaled by the width (w) and height (h) of the fill region, so that the vector becomes ( w cos x, h sin x ) (before normalization).

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TDrawingPathGradient.FillToRect
member.summary:
This element defines the "focus" rectangle for the center shade, specified relative to the fill tile rectangle.
The center shade fills the entire tile except the margins specified by each attribute.
Each edge of the center shade rectangle is defined by a percentage offset from the corresponding edge of the tile rectangle. A positive percentage specifies an inset, while a negative percentage specifies an outset.

member.summary: Specifies the shape of the path to follow.

member.summary: Specifies where to align the first tile with respect to the shape. Alignment happens after the scaling, but before the additional offset.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TBlipFillTile.Flip
member.summary: Specifies the direction(s) in which to flip the source image while tiling. Images can be flipped horizontally, vertically, or in both directions to fill the entire region.

member.summary: Specifies an extra horizontal offset after alignment.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TBlipFillTile.Ty
member.summary: Specifies an extra vertical offset after alignment.

member.summary: Creates a new Image fill.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TBlipFill.Dpi
member.summary: Specifies the DPI (dots per inch) used to calculate the size of the blip. If not present or zero, the DPI in the blip is used.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TBlipFill.RotateWithShape
member.summary: Specifies that the fill should rotate with the shape.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TBlipFill.Blip
member.summary: Picture and properties used in the Blip fill.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TBlipFill.SourceRect
member.summary: This element specifies the portion of the blip used for the fill. Each edge of the source rectangle is defined by a percentage offset from the corresponding edge of the bounding box. A positive percentage specifies an inset, while a negative percentage specifies an outset. For example, a left offset of 25% specifies that the left edge of the source rectangle is located to the right of the bounding box's left edge by an amount equal to 25% of the bounding box's width.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TBlipFill.FillMode
member.summary: Specifies how the blip will be applied to the fill, either by stretching it to cover all the surface, of by tiling it.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.VirtualCellReadEventArgs.Cell
member.summary: Value and position of a cell.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.VirtualCellReadEventArgs.NextSheet
member.summary:
Sheet where the next cell will be. By default, this value is set automatically, but you can change to other value to skip some sheets, or set it to null or empty to end reading the file.
If for example you are at sheet "Sheet1" and set NextSheet to be "Sheet5", then the next time this event is called it will be with the first cell of Sheet5. To stop reading this sheet and move to the next, set "NextSheet" to be [.Sheet]

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Core.VirtualCellReadEventArgs.SheetNames
member.summary: Array with all the sheet names in the file. You can use this array and .Sheet to know the current and next sheet names.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TZippyReader
member.summary: Simple class for reading the contents of a zip file. It can read from multiple files at the same time, but not multithreaded.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TZippyReader.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new TZippyReader.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TZippyReader.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new TZippyReader specifying if the files are case-insensitive. Note: Zip files by default are *not* case insensitive, but you might need this for compatibility with wrong xlsx files where the listed file doesn't match the case of the actual file. (Excel opens those files fine).
member.param: If true, files inside the zip will be treated the same ignoring the case. So README.TXT and readme.txt will be considered the same file.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TZippyReader.Open(System.String)
member.summary: Opens an existing filename. If the file isn't a supported zip file, an Exception will be raised.
member.param: File to open.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TZippyReader.Open(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Opens an existing stream for reading. If the file isn't a supported zip file, an exception will be raised. If you prefer to not raise an exception, use instead.
member.param: Stream that contains the file to load.
If true, aStream will be destroyed when you destroy this object. If false, no attempt to free the Stream will be done.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TZippyReader.TryOpen(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Tries to open a zip file and load the contents. If the file is invalid no Exception will be thrown. Note that other exceptions like a disk read error will still be raised. You can use this method instead of "if (TZippyReader.IsZipValid(stream)) TZippyReader.Open(stream)" as it will be faster because it doesn't have to read the file twice.
member.param: Stream that contains the file to load.
If true, aStream will be destroyed when you destroy this object. If false, no attempt to free the Stream will be done

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TZippyReader.Close
member.summary: Frees the memory associated with the object, and if this class owns the stream, it will free the associated stream too.
member.remarks: There is normally no need to call this method, since it will be automatically called when you dispose the object.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TZippyReader.ExtractFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Extracts a file from the zip file into the disk.
member.param: Name of the file on the zip file. See description and remarks at .
Name of the extracted file on the disk.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TZippyReader.ExtractFile(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Extracts a file from the zip file into the disk.
member.param: Index (0 based) of the file. Must be between 0 and - 1.
Name of the extracted file on the disk.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TZippyReader.CopyStream(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Utility method. Copies the stream from input to output.
member.param: Input stream.
Output stream.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TZippyReader.FileCount
member.summary: Returns the number of files inside the zip file, including files in all folders.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TZippyReader.FileExists(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if a file exists inside the zip file.
member.param: File that you want to find. If the file is in a folder, you must always use a forward slash ("/") to separate folders. The name shouldn't start with a slash. Names are case sensitive. Empty folders are stored as files with zero size and ending in a forward slash. Non empty folders are not stored.
member.returns: True if the file exists, false otherwise.

remarks.para: To find the filename "test.xml" inside a folder "TestFolder", you need to use:
Note how there isn't a starting slash, and that the name is case sensitive.
if (FileExists("/TestFolder/test.xml")) would return false, as would if (FileExists("testfolder/test.xml"))
An empty folder would be stored as a 0 byte file: 'EmptyFolder/'. Non empty folders are not stored.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TZippyReader.GetFile(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a stream with the contents of file aFileName. You must free this stream once you are done reading, even if the TZippyReader object owns the main stream.
member.param: Name of the file. See description and remarks at .
member.returns: Stream with the file contents. You need to free this stream once you are done reading.
member.remarks: You might open more than one stream in parallel from the same file and read from them all at the same time. What you can't do is to read from those streams in different threads without synchronization, since this isn't thread safe.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TZippyReader.GetFile(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the contents of the file at position Index. See for description and remarks.
member.param: Index (0 based) of the file. Must be between 0 and - 1.
member.returns: Stream with the file contents. You must free this stream once you are done reading.

member.summary: Releases all resources used by the object.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Core.TZippyWriter.Add(System.String,System.DateTime,CoherentFlexCel.Core.TCompressionMode)
member.summary: Creates a new file in the zip file, and returns a new stream where you can write data to it on the fly. If you just want to add an existing stream or file to the zip file, use or instead. Important: The stream returned is owned by this TZippyWriter object, and you shouldn't destroy it.
member.param: FileName for the new file inside the zip file. For information and remarks about it, see
Date and time for the file that will be created inside the zip file.
How the file will be stored. We support deflated and stored modes. You can use stored to store files that are already compressed (like a png image), and deflated for the rest.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Draw.TGdipUIFontCollection
member.summary: This class contains a collection of the privately added fonts, and *won't dispose* them. Sadly GDI+ keeps the fonts alive after disposing them, so we can't dispose the font collection until the app exits. Take a look at: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/25583394/privatefontcollection-addmemoryfont-producing-random-errors-on-windows-server-20 http://archives.miloush.net/michkap/archive/2010/10/18/10077187.html See also gdiplus_fontcollection.csproj.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Draw.TGdipUIPen.#ctor(System.Drawing.Pen,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new UIPen which encapsulates an existing GDI+ Pen. Note that if you are encapsulating a pen from Pens.Color class, you need to pass false in aNeedsDispose, since this class shouldn't dispose the pen when disposing the class.
member.param: GDI+ pen which will define this pen.

If true, this class will own the GDI+ pen, and dispose it when you dispose the class. If false, the GDI+ pen will not be disposed when disposing this class. If you are using a pen from Pens class, you should set this to false. We don't want to dispose system pens.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Draw.TGdipUIPathGradientBrush
member.summary: Class encapsulating a GDI+ Path gradient.

member.name: M:CoherentFlexCel.Draw.TGdipUIPathGradientBrush.#ctor(System.Drawing.Drawing2D.PathGradientBrush,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new UIPathGradientBrush which encapsulates an existing GDI+ PathGradientBrush. Note that if you are encapsulating a brush from Brushes.Color class, you need to pass false in aNeedsDispose, since this class shouldn't dispose the brush when disposing the class.
member.param: GDI+ brush which will define this brush.

If true, this class will own the GDI+ brush, and dispose it when you dispose the class. If false, the GDI+ brush will not be disposed when disposing this class. If you are using a brush from Brushes class, you should set this to false. We don't want to dispose system brushes.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TZoomOptions
member.summary: Zoom options for a PDF destination.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TZoomOptions.None
member.summary: None, leave the zoom unchanged.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TZoomOptions.Fit
member.summary: Display the page with its contents magnified just enough to fit the entire page within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the page within the window in the other dimension.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TZoomOptions.FitH
member.summary: Display the page with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of the page within the window.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TZoomOptions.FitV
member.summary: Display the page with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of the page within the window.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TZoomOptions.Zoom
member.summary: Display the page with the coordinates (left, top) posi- tioned at the upper-left corner of the window and the contents of the page magnified by the factor zoom. A negative value for any of the parameters left, top, or zoom specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained un- changed. A zoom value of 0 has the same meaning as a negative value.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TFontEmbed
member.summary: The way fonts will be embedded on the resulting pdf file.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TFontEmbed.None
member.summary: No font will be embedded. The result file will be smaller, but the file might not look fine on a computer without the font installed. It is recommended that you embed the fonts.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TFontEmbed.Embed
member.summary: All fonts will be embedded. The file will be larger than when not embedding fonts, but it will print on any computer. Note that you can control which fonts to embed and which not with the OnFontEmbed event.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TFontEmbed.OnlySymbolFonts
member.summary: This is a compromise between embedding all fonts and not embedding them. It will only embed fonts with symbols, and leave normal fonts not embedded.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TFontSubset
member.summary: Determines if full fonts will be embedded in the generated pdf files, or only the characters being used.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TFontSubset.DontSubset
member.summary: All characters of the font will be embedded into the file. This setting creates bigger files, but they can be edited after generated.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TFontSubset.Subset
member.summary: Only characters actually used by the document will be embedded into the file. This will create smaller files than embedding the full font, but it will be difficult to edit the document once it has been created.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TFontMapping
member.summary: How fonts will be replaced on the generated PDF file.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TFontMapping.ReplaceStandardFonts
member.summary: Arial will be replaced with Helvetica, Times new roman with Times and True type Courier with PS1 Courier. All other fonts will remain unchanged.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TFontMapping.ReplaceAllFonts
member.summary: Serif fonts will be mapped to Times, MonoSpace to Courier, Sans-Serif to Helvetica and Symbol fonts to Symbol. Using this option you can get the smallest file sizes and 100% portability, but the resulting file will only use those fonts. Use it with care, specially if you use symbol fonts.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TFontMapping.DontReplaceFonts
member.summary: All actual fonts will be used. If you use this option and do not embed fonts, the fonts will look bad on computers without them installed. If you embed fonts, files will be larger.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TPdfFontFolderNotFoundAction
member.summary: Determines what CoherentFlexCel should do when a font folder doesn't exist.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TPdfFontFolderNotFoundAction.DefaultBehavior
member.summary: This event won't change how the action is handled. If you set for example a static property to "Error" and an instance property to "DefaultBehavior", the final result will be "Error". If all properties are set to DefaultBehavior, this property will work as "Ignore"

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TPdfFontFolderNotFoundAction.Ignore
member.summary: CoherentFlexCel will ignore the folders that don't exist, and keep searching the other font folders you specified. Note that at least one folder in the list of folders must exist, or CoherentFlexCel will raise an error anyway.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TPdfFontFolderNotFoundAction.Error
member.summary: CoherentFlexCel will throw an exception if any folder doesn't exist.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TUnlicensedFontAction
member.summary: Determines what to do when trying to embed a font that isn't licensed for embedding.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TUnlicensedFontAction.Error
member.summary: If the font doesn't have a valid license, CoherentFlexCel will throw an exception and won't complete the exporting.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TUnlicensedFontAction.Replace
member.summary: If the font doesn't have a valid license, CoherentFlexCel will replace it by the font specified in the UnlicensedFontReplacement property.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TUnlicensedFontAction.Ignore
member.summary: CoherentFlexCel won't look at the licensing of the font, and embed it anyway. Note that to use this option, you need to have a copyright agreement to distribute the font with its owner. Also note that in PDF/A mode this option is similar to Error and an Exception will be thrown. This is because PDF/A doesn't allow to embed fonts which don't have the correct license, and the document wouldn't validate.

member.summary: Arguments passed on . Use this event to provide font information for embedding.

member.summary: Creates a new Argument.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.GetFontFolderEventArgs.FontPath
member.summary:
Return here the font path to the "Fonts" folder where ttf files are located.
CoherentFlexCel will search in the folder you return here, and in **all subfolders** of that folder for ttf files.
In MonoDroid, we use a "@folder" syntax to refer to assets. So for example to specify that the fonts are in the "fonts" folder asset, return "@fonts" here. If the fonts are in a normal folder, just return the folder.
You can return more than one folder here, separating them with semicolons (;). So you could for example return the string 'c:\font1folder;c:\font2folder' and CoherentFlexCel will search insed font1folder and font2folder.
Note: In CoherentFlexCel 6 we've changed this name from "FontFolder" to "FontPath" because the behavior changed, so you code won't compile and you get a chance to fix the FontFolder references. In CoherentFlexCel 5 or older, after specifying the path, CoherentFlexCel would append "..\Fonts" to whatever you specified, unless a variable "AppendFontFolder" was true. In CoherentFlexCel 6 we've simplified this in order to comply with all the possible font folders in different OSs. Now "FontPath" is the actual font path, CoherentFlexCel won't add anything to it.
When replacing FontFolder by FontPath in your app, make sure to Add "..\Fonts" if needed, as FontPath won't add it.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.GetFontFolderEventArgs.Applied
member.summary: Set Applied = false if the font is not being processed by the event, and CoherentFlexCel should try to find the font path for the font as if the event wasn't assigned.

member.name: P:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.GetFontFolderEventArgs.InputFont
member.summary: The font for which you need to return the data.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TPdfGradient
member.summary: A pdf gradient. It would be nice if we could use gradients of type 1 here because of 2 advantages: 1) They can be reused. A gradient of type 2 or 3 has the coordinates implicit, so 2 gradients for 2 different cells will need 2 different objects 2) They are stored in streams, so they can be compressed with object streams. Sadly, type 1 gradients don't look to be implemented by most alternate pdf viewers, and also using a linear interpolation function (type 0) doesn't work very well with gradient positions. A type 0 function assumes all values of the x parameters to be uniform in the range, and a gradient with might have positions anywhere. Note: An special case is SetSigmaBellShape, this will create 256 values with uniform positions. To avoid creating 256 type2 functions and then join them in a big stitching type3 function, we will use a type0 function for them.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.PdfMessages
member.summary:
CoherentFlexCel Native PDF Constants. It reads the resources from the active locale, and returns the correct string. If your language is not supported and you feel like translating the messages, please send us a copy. We will include it on the next CoherentFlexCel version.
To add a new language:
Copy the file pdfmsg.resx to your language (for example, pdfmsg.es.resx to translate to spanish)
Edit the new file and change the messages.
Add the .resx file to the CoherentFlexCel project

member.summary: A normal pdf file.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TPdfType.PDFA1
member.summary: PDF/A-1a or b (http://en.wikipedia.org/?title=PDF/A) Note that PDF/A-1 generates larger files than PDF/A-2, and also doesn't support transparency. But PDF/A-1 is a more commonly used standard at the time of writing this documentation.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TPdfType.PDFA2
member.summary: PDF/A-2a or b. CoherentFlexCel will create smaller files in PDF/A-2 mode than in PDF/A-1 mode, so if possible you should try to use PDF/A-2 instead of A1. A2 also supports transparency. In CoherentFlexCel case, CoherentFlexCel can also sign PDF/A-2 files, but no PDF/A-1.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TPdfType.PDFA3
member.summary: PDF/A-3. Note that the only difference with PDF/A2 is the ability to embed other files inside the PDF file.

member.name: T:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TPdfVersion

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TPdfVersion.v14
member.summary: The files will be in Pdf 1.4 format (Acrobat 5). Older Acrobat versions will still able to open the file, but might miss features like transparency.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TPdfVersion.v16
member.summary: The files will be in Pdf 1.6 format (Acrobat 7). This allows for smaller files, but older Acrobat versions won't be able to open the file at all. You'll need Acrobat 7 or newer to see them.

member.name: F:CoherentFlexCel.Pdf.TPdfVersion.v17
member.summary: The files will be in Pdf 1.7 format (Acrobat 8). You need Pdf 1.7 to sign files with SHA512. Since SHA1 is deprecated for signing, CoherentFlexCel will automatically choose v17 if the document is signed, no matter which version you manually select.
